story:
Kawolo Hospital Water Project

Uganda, East Africa August 2012

H2O 4 ALL is traveling to Uganda, East Africa to install a clean water system at Kawolo Hospital. The Kawolo Hospital Water Project will be implemented through the partnership of Save the Mothers (Uganda, East Africa) and H2O 4 ALL (Canada).


Project Description

H2O 4 ALL will build a Clean Water System on the grounds of the maternity ward of the Kawolo Hospital just outside of Kampala, Uganda in August 2012. The project involves the creation of 25,000 litre tanks with solar pumps, PVC piping from the tanks into the Hospital and installation of H2O 4 ALL disinfection system. The project will provide on average approximately 5,000 L of water per month for cleaning, washing and all needs of the maternity ward.

This clean water project is in partnership with Save the Mothers’ Mother-Friendly Health Initiative at Kawolo Hospital. The more dignity and care given to a woman, the more likely the mother will deliver her baby in a hospital or health centre. Presently in Uganda, a country with the same population as Canada, 16 women die every day from pregnancy or childbirth complications. In Canada, less than 16 women die each year from similar complications.

The Kawolo Hospital

The Kawolo Hospital facilities have hospital beds, mattresses, theatre operating table and delivery beds which are all broken down and now medical workers just improvise to be able to offer services. The Kawolo Hospital was built in 1968 and handles 350 outpatient cases every day and serves Buikwe, Mukono, Kayunga and Buvuma districts of Uganda. The hospital faces inadequate staff with only six doctors serving a population of more than 600,000 people.

Impact of Kawolo Hospital Clean Water System

Nearly every minute a mother dies from preventable pregnancy and childbirth complications! Those deaths result in a growing number of orphans, whose lives are also at risk. We believe that by saving a mother from preventable death, we are saving the person most likely to ensure the care, education and health of the next generation. Women, especially in Africa, are also major contributors to the local economy.

The high number of maternal deaths in some areas of the world reflects inequities in access to health services, and highlights the gap between rich and poor. Almost all maternal deaths (99%) occur in developing countries. More than half of these deaths occur in sub-Saharan Africa and one third occur in South Asia.

H2O 4 ALL’s clean water project will reduce the likelihood of water-borne illnesses at the hospital, including dysentery, improve cleanliness and hygiene at the maternity ward, and increase the overall community health by reducing incidences of dysentery and other ailments transmitted through unclean water. The Kawolo hospital services 600,000  people.

H2O 4 ALL’s clean water project will help Kawolo Hospital meet the standards of care for safe childbirth. This project has the power to transform

Where does your money go?

H2O 4 ALL is proud to say that 100% of funds received for this project will go towards making this project happen!

H2O 4 ALL

To date through partnerships on the ground all of our projects in Colombia, South America, Liberia, Sierra Leone, Ghana, Uganda and Zambia Africa immediately impact the life of many, especially women and children, who have the responsibility to gather water daily. H2O 4 ALL impacts the lives of over 150,000 people every single day. H2O 4 ALL uses water to create sustainable socioeconomic growth in these developing countries.

story: Hi, my name is Claudia, I am from Germany and since 5 years I am living in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. In October 2011 we had a little baby girl born 7 weeks premature. Luckily we had a good insurance and the NICU hospital bill was covered in full. Our baby weighs now 7kg and we are a happy family. This morning I read in the local newspaper about a little baby boy who was born 13 weeks premature  weighing 1,1 kg on June 17 here in Dubai. Unfortunately the parents don't have insurance and the neonatal intensive care hospital bill is already at $ 55,000. Little Yaroslav is still needing oxygen and they do not know when they will be allowed to take him home. Eventhough medical care is really good in Dubai it is really expensive as well and many people do not have an insurance. The additional problem here in Dubai is that you might end up in jail if you are not able to pay your debts . I am very thankful that I had insurance and thanks to the fantastic NICU team at a private hospital here in Dubai, UAE. I have a very healthy baby girl...the sunshine of our live. Since not everybody is a lucky as I am I decided to start this campaign...my first campaign on Indiegogo. Eventhough i have not met Viktor and Anastasia, the parents of Yaroslav so far, I am sure they will be thankfull for every $ Please help this little family with a small donation so that they can spend all their energy on caring for their tiny baby boy. Thank you so much :-)

story:
The Problem:

Safe and affordable clean water is the biggest challenge facing the developing world. Using an innovative technology that uses inexpensive nanomagnets, we have developed a water treatment technology that is affordable for small rural villages in regions of the developing world. 

Our Solution:

Using the latest innovations in Physics, Chemistry, and Material Science we have created nanomaterials that can scavenge, bind, and extract contaminants from water without the use of electricity, complicated machinery, or expensive membranes. This is the first-of-its kind water treatment technology that can be effective and affordable to be used in rural areas in the developing world for removing various harmful contaminants such as industrial waste, heavy metals, and biological substances that cause waterborne illnesses.

Hand pumped water well in rural community
 
Arsenic Toxicity-- A 10 year old girl suffering from Arsenic poisoning

Our Vision: 

More than 200 million people are affected by harmful Arsenic heavy metal contamination in developing areas such as Bangladesh and parts of India. As an initial area of focus, we are modifying our water treatment technology platform to treat and remove Arsenic from drinking well water. In cooperation with the World Health Organization and other organizations, we will install ADS Arsenic water treatment systems for well water applications in rural villages at the size of ~40 families or more. For as little as $5,000, a community of 40 families in areas of Bangladesh and India can have clean water for the next 20 years, and additional operational expenses will be paid annually by the local community for less than $1 per family/per year. This is an affordable and revolutionary technology and will have the ability to provide safe and affordable clean water for millions of people. Our vision is safe water free of heavy metal contamination for millions across effected areas of Bangladesh and India.

The novel and inexpensive ADS Arsenic Water Treatment Technology

Why indiegogo? 

Long waiting time associated with collaborating institutions worldwide have hindered our ability to implement our technology and help people in the developing world effected by Arsenic contamination in well water such as Bangladesh and India. We are therefore hoping to use the global community to help provide rural areas of Bangladesh and India with safe affordable water. Every dollar helps! Since we plan to crowd-source funding for our water treatment technology for a number of rural communities, we are asking the indiegogo community to help us gain the necessary capital funding to save as many lives as possible. We have the resources and technology and with your help we can take this technology out of the developing stage and make this project a reality to save countless lives. 

Timeline: 

We have successfully designed and tested the ADS Arsenic removal water treatment technology and will begin building multiple systems and implementing the systems in rural villages in India and Bangladesh after the successful completion of the indiegogo project crowd-funding. We expect to deliver and install water treatment systems that can treat 3-5 gallons or more per minute (gpm), to be operational by November 2012 and we will keep our indiegogo community contributors in the loop with a quarterly email newsletter. We are expecting a 2-3 month development and implementation timeline from the closing date of the indiegogo pledge. In as little as 3 months your name could be on the long list of those actively pursuing change for the developing world. 

Our Commitment?

With every dollar pledged, we will use every penny for direct cost of development and implementation of water systems for Arsenic removal, these systems will be developed and installed at cost. As we are a for-profit company, we pledge to provide all in-kind-support and administration support for this project and will not receive any profit above the cost of production and implementation. With ongoing collaborations we have with non-profit and for-profit institutions globally, we have water well sites already pre-screened and evaluated for proper implementation in rural villages of Bangladesh and India. We are hoping to implement at least 10 water treatment systems for at least 10 communities and with more pledge money we will implement more water treatment systems across the developing world. We have hundreds of sites where our technology can help small rural villages across multiple regions plagued by Arsenic water contamination, we therefore hope to have a positive impact to as many people as possible. 

Our offer to those who pledge: 

Every contributor will have the choice of having his or her name mentioned at a water treatment system launching ceremony. All contributions are welcomed and a few dollars can go a long way to providing clean water to those in need. All contributors will be updated monthly on our progress with specific information about the water treatment systems and villages their money has gone to support.

Pledges of $3 or more will receive online updates of the water systems you have helped to facilitate as well as your name added to the online webpage of contributors. Have the satisfaction of joining the list of individuals making a difference in the lives of thousands of people in India and Bangladesh with the novel inexpensive ADS water treatment technology.

Pledges of $39 or more will have distinguished contributor status online and their name mentioned at a water treatment system launching ceremony in Bangladesh or India as well as receive a commemorative ADS Water Treatment Save a Family Pen in recognition of their contribution. 

Pledges of $199 or more will receive the above mentioned launching ceremony mention and pen as well as an ADS Save a Village Plaque delivered to you in recognition of your gracious contribution. Plaques can be in your name or memorialized and dedicated to others. For memorial/dedication please email info@advantageoussystems.com with the name and 10 word memorial dedication after making your pledge on indiegogo.

Pledges of $10,000 or more will, in addition to the above recognition, receive an invitation to visit the rural communities that their contribution has sponsored in Bangladesh or India on a 5 day all expense paid community event honoring those who have pledged to change lives. This 5 day trip includes airfare as well as local transportation, food, and board for two individuals. For more information please email info@advantageoussystems.com 

 How you can help: 

1. Back us! Please make a donation through indigogo by clicking the pledge button. It's easy. If you have any challenges, or need an alternate way to contribute, email us at info@advantageoussystems.com 

2. Spread the word: Post to Facebook, Twitter, send emails to friends. Visit www.advantageoussystems.com for further information on our revolutionizing technology. Spread our TED talk explaining our water treatment technologies- 

3. Got skills? Have energy? Join us! If you are a world-class engineer, scientist, marketer, investor, or just think your particular skills might be helpful to us and our project, we’d love to talk to you and see how you can help change the lives of millions around the world. Drop us a line at: info@advantageoussystems.com

story:
Faye's Light and Enactus UIC


Founded by Vicky Weis, Faye's Light is a 501(c)(3), not-for-profit organization, which provides comfort, love, and support to those currently undergoing treatment for cancer. We do this by providing quality of life services, including holistic treatments and spa services, with a focus on mind, body, and spirit. . . all at no cost to the patient. 

After Vicky's mother, Faye passed away from cancer, Vicky dedicated her life to creating a community for support and treatment for cancer patients. 

Since Vicky is  operating Faye's Light on her own, UIC ENACTUS is taking initiative to help her in fundraising and awareness.  All services are free to active cancer patients. Any help will be greatly appreciated.

What is Enactus UIC?

We are the University of Illinois at Chicago chapter of the international organization Enactus. Enactus is a community of students committed to using the power of entrepreneurial action to transform lives and shape a better more sustainable world. 

More about Faye's Light:

Faye's Light benefits the patient in mind, body, and spirit. Faye's Light provides a variety of holistic services. A wonderful sense of community is formed among the patients as they wait for their next service. They benefit from having the opportunity to share their stories with others going through similar experiences. For some, this is their only interaction with people not directly involved with their treatment/disease. The services provided by Faye's Light professionals allow truly deserving individuals an escape from the fear and anxiety of their disease – if only for an hour or two every week.

Contributions will be able to cover costs related to the following services:

Reiki, Reflexology, Guided Meditation, Creative Arts, Restorative Sound Therapy, Healing Touch, Massage, Facial, Manicure, Pedicure, Hypo-Allergenic Cleaning Services (Laundry Service), Wholesome Food, etc.


If you are unable to contribute financially, please share our campaign so others are aware of the organization and what it does. Perhaps you know someone affected by cancer who can utilize the services. There will also be an Annual Faye's Light Walk in May, sponsors and participants are needed. More information is available at: http://www.fayeslight.org/


Here are some other ways in which you can contribute: 

  • Make a donation
  • Dedicate a memorial or tribute
  • Support our fundraising events
  • Knit or crochet hats, prayer shawls and booties
  • Offer office assistance
  • Chair or help with fundraising events
  • Grant writing
  • Caretaking
  • Gardening
  • Donate office supplies

Faye’s Light Facebook Page: 

https://www.facebook.com/fayeslight


Video for Enactus: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FZjmF0-cdD0


Twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/FayesLight

Website: http://www.fayeslight.org


See Our School's Name at Enactus's Site : 

http://enactus.org/country/united-states/

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=itZIojcAHgU

story:
Hello, My name is Kyle Houlihan.  On March 2, 2010, I was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes.  I was 9 years old.

It was a very scary time for me and my entire family.  I was freaked out at the beginning, but after all of the doctors visits/training seminars for the management of my blood glucose levels, I began to live my new life. 

I definitely did not want to be treated differently because of my diabetes.  l'd have to carry all of my supplies with me all the time and I thought I would stand out from my friends and be different. 

The worst part was the bag that I was given at the hospital to carry my supplies looked like a girls purse.  I was always leaving the bag behind.  At home, school, and restaurants.  I wasn't trying to leave it behind, it just happened and this was dangerous as my levels would get low and I did not have my supplies with me.

I searched all over to find some sort of bag that would work to carry my stuff and be cool and not make me stand out.  I searched and searched with no luck.  In February of 2011,with a little help from my Dad, I decided to draw up my own bag.

The Vitalpak !!!

I designed Vitalpak to help make my life easier and more organized.  Now I always have essential supplies with me and ready.

I am now 13 and I am so close to sharing my Vitalpak with the world.  I have seen multiple prototypes and after almost 3 years we have a final product design.  

I need your help!  I am asking for your support in raising $40,000.00 for this project.  This will go a long way in helping me build “The Vitalpak essentials backpack”. 

I have learned so much on this project and I am so close.  Thank you so much to my sister Madeline and my family and thank you very much for supporting me!

Kyle


VitalPak Description:


VitalPak is the first medical backpack that combines style, function and organization. The VitalPak backpack can be used as a way of organizing all your supplies in one case, but with the unique feature of a removable mini pack that includes designated spaces for blood glucose monitor, testing supplies, insulin pens and needles, as well as safe sharps container. VitalPak can be used as a hanging organized storage pack at home which can quickly go portable when needed.

Though created as a way for diabetics to carry their medical supplies around in an organized and stylish manner, the VitalPak’s abilities are nearly endless. Build your VitalPak Essentials Kit to your specific needs – First Aid, Asthma, Allergies, etc. Carry your essential medical supplies in a functional and fashionable way with the VitalPak Medical Backpack with Removalbe, Snap-in Essentials Kit.

Available Colors: Black – Red/Burgandy – Orange – Navy/Blue – Light Grey – Grey/Navy

  • Durable, water resistant, nylon body material
  • Molded foam shoulder straps for support & comfort
  • Large main compartment with organization & internal zip pocket
  • Small front panel stash pocket
  • Removable, Snap-in Essentials Kit
  • York-style shoulder harness
  • Large front mesh drop pocket
  • Protected ID compartment


VitalPak Notes:

For all those currently living with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes as well as those with asthma, allergies or the need of general medical portable storage.  It is the intention for a portion of the sale of the Vitalpak to annually go to Kyle’s fundraising page "Houli's Herd" for the American Diabetes Association.  With your help and support of this project Kyle hopes to not only provide customers with a great solution in the form of a medical backpack, but also give to the A.D.A. to help others in need.

Kyle is offering some great perks for you!  Discounts on the vitalpak!  You can give as a gift to a family member or friend in need, or as a great raffle prize for a fundraiser in your hometown.

Thank you in advance for your support for Kyle's product.  Please direct to indigogo any friends or diabetes sufferers who you may know that may be interested in supporting Kyle's product and cause.  Helping Kyle reach his goal and beyond!!!!

At home, school, and restaurants. 
I wasn't trying to leave it behind, it just happened and this was dangerous as my levels would get low and I did not have my supplies with me.
I searched all over to find some sort of bag that would work to carry my stuff and be cool and not make me stand out. 
I searched and searched with no luck.  In February of 2011,with a little help from my Dad, I decided to draw up my own bag.
The Vitalpak !!!
I designed Vitalpak to help make my life easier and more
organized.  Now I always have essential supplies with me and ready. 
I am now 13 and I am so close to sharing my Vitalpak with the world.  I have seen multiple prototypes and after almost 3 years we have a final product design.  I need your help!  I am asking for your support in raising $40,000.00 for this project.  This will go a long way in helping me build “The Vitalpak essentials backpack”.  I have learned so much on this project and I am so close.  Thank you so much to my sister Madeline and my family and thank you very much for supporting me!KyleVitalPak Description:VitalPak is the first medical backpack that combines style, function and organization. The VitalPak backpack can be used as a way of organizing all your supplies in one case, but with the unique feature of a removable mini pack that includes designated spaces for blood glucose monitor, testing supplies, insulin pens and needles, as well as safe sharps container. VitalPak can be used as a hanging organized storage pack at home which can quickly go portable when needed.Though created as a way for diabetics to carry their medical supplies around in an organized and stylish manner, the VitalPak’s abilities are nearly endless. Build your VitalPak Essentials Kit to your specific needs – First Aid, Asthma, Allergies, etc. Carry your essential medical supplies in a functional and fashionable way with the VitalPak Medical Backpack with Removalbe, Snap-in Essentials Kit.Available Colors: Black – Red/Burgandy – Orange – Navy/Blue – Light Grey – Grey/Navy
Durable, water resistant, nylon body material
Molded foam shoulder straps for support & comfort
Large main compartment with organization & internal zip pocket
Small front panel stash pocket
Removable, Snap-in Essentials Kit
York-style shoulder harness
Large front mesh drop pocket
Protected ID compartment



VitalPak Notes:For all those currently living with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes as well as those with asthma, allergies or the need of general medical portable storage.  It is the intention for a portion of the sale of the Vitalpak to annually go to Kyle’s fundraising page "Houli's Herd" for the American Diabetes Association.  With your help and support of this project Kyle hopes to not only provide customers with a great solution in the form of a medical backpack, but also give to the A.D.A. to help others in need.
Kyle is offering some great perks for you!  Discounts on the vitalpak!  You can give as a gift to a family member or
friend in need, or as a great raffle prize for a fundraiser in your hometown.
Thank you in advance for your support for Kyle's product.  Please direct to indigogo any friends or
diabetes sufferers who you may know that may be interested in supporting Kyle's product and cause.  Helping Kyle reach his goal and beyond!!!!

story:
Hi, my name is Elina. I'm a certified pilates instructor who is looking for raising funds to make my at home workout system which I called Elinates. Elinates will consist of 12 workouts, a workout schedule , nutrition guide & a guide with tips on how to stay on track with a diet, so I need to raise funds to pay a crew to shoot the workouts, edit them and make DVD's ready for purchase. I also will need to pay for making and printing of both of the guides and workout schedules. A small amount of the funds will be used to develop a marketing plan, which will include having a professional website made and printing promotional materials.
Your help of any sort (including sharing my campaign via social media) will be greatly appreciated. If you have any questions for me, I will be more than happy to answer them. My email is elinates2014@gmail.com. I appreciate you checking my campaign, have a wonderful day, Elina
  1. BRIEF DESCRIPTION: 

Elinates is a simple to follow, at-home workout system for beginners. Elinates combines Pilates, low - impact aerobics, Yoga, and physical therapy to help you get in shape without causing strain on your joints. 

VIDEO WITH A LONGER DESCRIPTION OF ELINATES: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8o4OwtuztcY&sns=fb

2. LONG DESCRIPTION

Elinates will be created so that absolutely everyone will have an opportunity to get a strong, lean, flexible and pain free body regardless of situation and physical challenges he or she faces. From common complaints like lack of time, exercise boredom, or too-hard-to-follow workout routines, to specifically addressing serious injuries, such as bulging disks, neck and shoulder pain, etc. which limit a person's ability to do high impact workouts, Elinates is able to combat a wide variety of issues that people face when it comes to being fit for life.

Elinates is a completely low-impact, at home workout system. Low-impact workouts are defined as“Any type of aerobic exercise which promotes physical fitness but does not stress the musculoskeletal tissues and joints.” What this means, for the average person, is that Elinates has no jumping, running, squats or push – ups. While Elinates will work for everyone, those who will see the most drastic results would be people new to working out or anyone who is looking to get a strong, lean, flexible and pain free body without too much strain on their joints. 

IT WILL BE OFFERED IN 2 OPTIONS: 

Option 1: 

-Working out five days per week (workout schedule, nutrition guide and a separate guide with tips on how to stay on track with a diet and workout regime will be included). 

You will get a workout schedule with instructions on which workout to do which day. It will come with 4 mandatory workouts which you have to accomplish every week (to ensure the results) and an extra optional 5th workout which will consist of dynamic stretches (stretches done in motion) for your entire body. 

-Option 1 is a great choice for beginners or people who are short on time. It is designed to ease you into Elinates

Option 2: 

-Working out 6 days per week for 30 days. 

-The system will include 12 different workouts, a workout schedule, nutrition guide and a separate guide with tips on how to stay on track with a diet and workout regime. 

-It will include an extra 55 minutes workout which will include exercises to strengthen (tone) the core (abs, lower back, glutes & hamstrings) and extra aerobics exercises to help burn more calories. 

-Option 2 is a great option for people who are looking for a better challenge, want extra core work, or have a bit more time. 

  • BENEFITS OF ELINATES: 

1. It is completely low-impact. People with injuries or other health limitations are able to benefit from the system.

2. It will help you lose weight without causing strain or impact on the joints. 

3. It integrates a wide variety of exercises from physical therapy, Pilates, yoga & dancing. 

4. There is no equipment required. 

5. It will help strengthen (tone) the entire body and especially the core (abs, lower back, glutes & hamstrings) and increase your flexibility.

6. Prevent new injuries, help with the ones which you might have and decrease random aches and pains with specific exercises and stretches. 

7. It will teach you the basics of working out & healthy eating.

8. Each exercise comes with detailed instructions and modifications so everyone can do it. 

9. It comes with two different options to ensure that everyone's needs are met

What I need your help with and production plan: 

In order to make Elinates happen, I need to raise funds to pay a crew to shoot the workouts, edit them and make DVD's ready for purchase. I also will need to pay for making and printing of both of the guides and workout schedules. A small amount of the funds will be used to develop a marketing plan, which will include having a professional website made and printing promotional materials.

PRODUCTION PLAN: 

1. All the workouts will be made and tested by July 25, 2014.

2. The first drafts of all the guides (nutrition guide & the guide with tips on how to stay committed to clean eating and program) will be made by July 25, 2014

3. I have already found a crew to shoot and edit the videos; the DVDs will be made by September 25, 2014. 

4. By November 1, 2014, the DVD's and the guides will be ready for sale (the guides will be printed and properly formatted; DVDs burned and packaged) and basic marketing will be done (the website made, YouTube channel set up, and all promotional materials printed). 

FINAL THOUGHTS: 

While I will be making Elinates, I will constantly post live updates on social media sites, including Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. I will also will be replying daily to all the comments and any questions you might have. Elinates is my primary focus and priority, and I will see it through to completion. 

Elinates has been my very long-term dream. I've spent years collecting and trying out exercises and workout techniques on myself, personal training clients, and students. All of them, including myself, have seen amazing results, ranging from weight-loss, gaining strength, to a decrease in aches and pains.

Any kind of help and support will be greatly appreciated. If you are not able to donate, please share mycampaign with your friends and family. 

If you would like to see examples of the exercises which will be used for Elinates Workouts (the kind of exercises), please check out my YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/Bandilates/videos

The twitter & instagram where you will be able to read the real time updates on Elinates: 

twitter.com/elinates2014; instagram: elinates2014

My facebook: https://www.facebook.com/prettyfitgirl

I will be more than happy to answer any questions you might have for me as they pertain to the Elinates method. 

Email me at: elinates2014@gmail.com, 

I hope you liked my campaign, 

Have a wonderful day, 

Elina

story:
COLDTOX® is our unique new cosmetic forumla combining 3 of the latest active ingredients.

We work tirelessly to produce the best, most innovative, skincare solutionsto re-create your daily skincare routine.

But we need your help to launch our latest treatment.

Combining the magic of nature with the knowledge of science we produce luxurious skin care treatments based on years of research and experience.

Everyone loves to feel special and skinChemists has helped revolutionise women's lives through great skin health.

Looking good, feeling confident, this matters!

COLDTOX® is the result of years of intense research to make a cosmetic based treatment that aims to deliver substantial skincare results. We are SO proud of our research team that has combined the active ingredients Marine Collagen, Snow Algae and Glacier Water to create COLDTOX®.


About skinChemists

The story behind skinChemists is really all about passion. Passionate chemists who understood that looking and feeling your best made the world of difference to a person’s life. Even back in 1897, the dedication to quality and the commitment to results were there to be seen for the people they served.

Our history goes right back to the 1890s, when our company Ridleys was celebrating Queen Victoria's Jubilee. One of the top sellers in 1897 was Quinine and Tonic, a restorative mixture as it was called. It sounds lovely doesn’t it!?

My Father, the Chemist Francis G. F. Walker, graduated as a Pharmaceutical Chemist and member of the Pharmaceutical Society of Great Britain on the 7th September 1955.

After graduating with my own Bachelor of Science (Hons) Degree, it was a forgone conclusion that I would stay in the family trade. The trade that I had seen transform people’s lives for as long as I could remember.

It was instilled in me from an early age that quality, refinement and a dedication to excellence were what we should strive for daily.

At skinChemists we have followed that founding principle. Like my Father, I travel the globe working with the best minds, using the best research and the most innovative active ingredients in the world. 

skinChemists conquered Europe in 2011 with our famous Wrinkle Killer Snake Serum, using the Swiss Technology Award winning Syn-Ake active ingredient.

Our research centres in the UK and Florida are at the forefront of research, creating world beating formulations especially for you.

Now, we are developing a revolutionary NEW formulation, again, embracing that union of science and nature...COLDTOX® is the future of skincare.

The story is just beginning.

Join the skinChemists family.

Richard

skinChemists


About COLDTOX®

skinChemists COLDTOX® is a revolutionary formulation.. when science meets nature, designed for you.

It’s in the DNA of everyone at skinChemists, science and nature provide the best basis for the best skin treatments.

The number 1 rule to keep you skin in tip-top condition is hydration hydration hydration! De-hydrated skin is the main cause of most skincare woes, from premature ageing to blemishes and oily or dry skin. This new formulation combines Award-Winning Snow Algae, and Glacier Water to help with skin hydration.

You can feel the wonderful, cooling sensation immediately upon application. And just wait.. for that hydration hit.

Our research centres on both sides of the pond have been working flat-out to perfect this formula, and thanks to a fabulous 'eureka' moment...we believe we have done it. We have created the future of skincare. 


Aims

What we want to achieve is simple. We know how good our existing products are. We've got the testimonies, we've got the women telling us every day.

We want to go one step further. We want to create a brand-new, unique range of products, with the aim to continue revolutionising your skincare routines.

Our Wrinkle Killer Snake Serum has been a consistent sell-out across Europe.

With a little bit of help from you, we want to continue to develop our range of products. We want to support the union of science and nature in skincare.

We want to start the COLDTOX® revolution. We just need a little bit of help getting there.


    Why we need your help!

    skinChemists needs you!

    Help us to bring our revolutionary new product, COLDTOX® to the world.

    Be part of the future of skincare.

story:
The Janice Steger Funeral and Memorial Fund

The last day of my mother's (Janice Steger's) fund (http://igg.me/at/JSteger) is here. 

Sixty days ago, when my sister and I were asked to create this fund on her behalf, we didn't have a clue what the crowd-funding world entailed. Not to say that our knowledge is profound now, but we now know a little bit more. We did all the right things to meet out set goal, aside from dole out a great deal of $$$ to "share" the word of her fund.

Two days before my mother's 68th birthday her site went live. We set a goal that was less than one-fourth of her medical bills at that time. It was a slow start, but the first contribution was receive less than 24 hours after it went live. Amazing!

You all were there to see her fight and her smile. Some of you were actually able to hear her laughter, which was the best and brings tears to my eyes every time I hear it now. Her birthday/radical mastectomy was successful, and she was operated on by the best, but ductal carcinoma being the oh-so-aggressive cancer that it is was just a little more successful. A few days past a month from her surgery, she was gone, which brings us to today – the last day of her fund. 

Through every phase and title of her fund you all have been so very supportive. For this, my dad Carey, my sister Chelsi and I thank you from the bottom of our hearts. My mother who was beside herself when her fund hit a mere 1% funded was so appreciative and is applauding you all for contributing $4135 thus far.

This money covers a little over 15% of her funeral expenses, and we are extremely thankful for your kindness. 

Thank you.

(Previously) The Janice Steger Funeral Fund

October 27, 2014, 4:48pm PDT, the Lord welcomed our mother Janice Steger with open arms. She resisted because she wanted to stay with us, but He had other plans for her; and unfaltering she suddenly followed him into heaven.

On the birthday of her own mother, she is now also with her mom and the Lord.

Her survivor fund is now her funeral fund. Beyond that, we don't know what else to do but pray that He takes good care of her.

(Previously) The Janice Steger Breast Cancer Survivor Fund

We, Janice Steger's daughters Sydni and Chelsi, have started this campaign or "The Janice Steger Breast Cancer Survivor Fund" to raise monies to help pay for our mother's breast cancer (stage 3 ductal carcinoma) chemotherapy treatments, mastectomy, lymph node removal, reconstruction, and recovery. 

We wanted a way or a positive venue for our mother's family, friends, students, and supporters to give back to a caring, graciously generous, and loving woman that has been there as a rock of support for her children (all our lives), her husband, her friends and family, and for so many others over the years. 

Your contribution will help pay for her recently completed chemotherapy treatments, her birthday mastectomy, which was scheduled and completed on Wednesday, September 24, 2014, and her additional chemotherapy treatments, radiation treatments, and reconstruction.

    To date, and in addition to her recent mastectomy, Janice has undergone six months of varying forms of chemotherapy that have left this vivacious and tirelessly devoted worshipper of God, mentor, wife, mother, grandmother, and friend utterly spent and physically exhausted. We are not out of the woods yet. The road is long, but she refuses to lose the fight again cancer, and you can help.

    When the chemo that took every stitch of her hair failed to kill all the cancer in her body, she continues to look forward... she continues to work and strive for her future. She continues on with her life, with a smile on her face and love in her heart; and miraculously with the hand that she's been dealt, her strength in spirit and unwavering faith allow her to meet every stage of her treatment with a positive outlook. Throughout all of her various treatments, she's remains diligent to keep living – attending church and bible study when she is physically able, and she has also found time to continue her efforts as a spiritual mentor and prayer leader. 

    We know Breast Cancer Awareness month (October) is coming to a close, but you still can help! Don't stop educating yourselves, making those procrastinated upon appointments, visit your loved ones who are dealing with cancer head on, make a contribution to your favorite cancer charity or cause, you can even make a small donation here. 

    We are humbled by the generosity given via time, services, gestures of love, prayers, phone calls, visits and monies that each and every one of you has bestowed upon our mother thus far. 

    We hope and are confident that your continued contributions will lessen the stress of finding monies (currently bills tally has surpassed the $200,000 USD mark), as our mother, Janice Steger, fights the good fight and beats cancer head on, and joins the ranks as one of the more than 2.8 million breast cancer survivors in the United States (cancer.org). 

      Janice Steger's Progress

      Please check the "UPDATES" tab and the "GALLERY" tab for more news on and photos of Janice's progress.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand that not everyone can contribute monetarily, and for those who can't, please continue to pray for Mom and our family.

      • For those who would prefer to send funds directly to the family, you are welcome to mail donations directly to Dad (Carey Steger) at PO Box 5024, Culver City, CA 90231.
      Thank you.

On the birthday of her own mother, she is now also with her mom and the Lord.
Her survivor fund is now her funeral fund. Beyond that, we don't know what else to do but pray that He takes good care of her.
(Previously) The Janice Steger Breast Cancer Survivor Fund We, Janice Steger's daughters Sydni and Chelsi, have started this campaign or "The Janice Steger Breast Cancer Survivor Fund" to raise monies to help pay for our mother's breast cancer (stage 3 ductal carcinoma) chemotherapy treatments, mastectomy, lymph node removal, reconstruction, and recovery. 
We wanted a way or a positive venue for our mother's family, friends, students, and supporters to give back to a caring, graciously generous, and loving woman that has been there as a rock of support for her children (all our lives), her husband, her friends and family, and for so many others over the years. 
Your contribution will help pay for her recently completed chemotherapy treatments, her birthday mastectomy, which was scheduled and completed on Wednesday, September 24, 2014, and her additional chemotherapy treatments, radiation treatments, and reconstruction.

To date, and in addition to her recent mastectomy, Janice has undergone six months of varying forms of chemotherapy that have left this vivacious and tirelessly devoted worshipper of God, mentor, wife, mother, grandmother, and friend utterly spent and physically exhausted. We are not out of the woods yet. The road is long, but she refuses to lose the fight again cancer, and you can help.
When the chemo that took every stitch of her hair failed to kill all the cancer in her body, she continues to look forward... she continues to work and strive for her future. She continues on with her life, with a smile on her face and love in her heart; and miraculously with the hand that she's been dealt, her strength in spirit and unwavering faith allow her to meet every stage of her treatment with a positive outlook. Throughout all of her various treatments, she's remains diligent to keep living – attending church and bible study when she is physically able, and she has also found time to continue her efforts as a spiritual mentor and prayer leader. 
We know Breast Cancer Awareness month (October) is coming to a close, but you still can help! Don't stop educating yourselves, making those procrastinated upon appointments, visit your loved ones who are dealing with cancer head on, make a contribution to your favorite cancer charity or cause, you can even make a small donation here. 
We are humbled by the generosity given via time, services, gestures of love, prayers, phone calls, visits and monies that each and every one of you has bestowed upon our mother thus far. 
We hope and are confident that your continued contributions will lessen the stress of finding monies (currently bills tally has surpassed the $200,000 USD mark), as our mother, Janice Steger, fights the good fight and beats cancer head on, and joins the ranks as one of the more than 2.8 million breast cancer survivors in the United States (cancer.org). 
  
Janice Steger's Progress
Please check the "UPDATES" tab and the "GALLERY" tab for more news on and photos of Janice's progress.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone can contribute monetarily, and for those who can't, please continue to pray for Mom and our family.
For those who would prefer to send funds directly to the family, you are welcome to mail donations directly to Dad (Carey Steger) at PO Box 5024, Culver City, CA 90231.
Thank you.

story:
What's going on:

We are asking for $1 donation. If you can afford more and wish to give more, please feel free to do so. 
We are here to help our dear friend Michael P recover from his crazy fall of 60ft! 
Hiking in Utah with a small group fell and tumbled down 60ft over rocks, debris, and landscape. He endured hours of pain while a member of the group ran up the trail to call 911 - thank goodness someone did! 3-hours later, and in horrible pain, a helicopter came and took Michael to the closest hospital which was in Colorado. A few days later the only doctor who could treat broken pelvises felt that the damage was too extensive and had Michael transferred and flown to Salt Lake City, Utah. 

After 5-hours of surgery to repair his pelvis it was explained that he had shattered the right side, including the hip socket and major fractures on the "wing" of his pelvis. A lot of hardware was placed to pull it all back together again, including four "plates" and a lot of screws.

After 2 weeks of post-op rehab he was moved to a skilled nursing facility in. He was there for 4 weeks; however, Insurance decided on Friday afternoon to discontinue his rehab treatments. So now his insurance is not covering a lot of the financial obligations.

Michael is now at home after 4-months since the fall, recovering slowly, but continues to have symptoms of post concussive syndrome, including short term memory loss, trouble with word finding, and processing issues. He is also mentally fatigued very easily, some of these are becoming easier, but there is still a long way to go.

What We Need & What You Get

Michael is working hard to recover and start to operate normally, however his finances are in trouble. 
We are asking for $1. If you can afford and want to donate more, please feel free to do so, but we are asking for $1 and to share this to one other person.
Michael is an archaeologist. Because of the fall he has not been able to work and bills have been stacking high for 4-months. He needs to pay for food, rent, payback 4-months of bills, and medical bills that insurance is not covering.

All funds go to Michael's medical needs first and then to his other needs.

    The Impact

    Michael is a huge part of our community in Grand Junction, Colorado. He has and is heavily involved in our community radio, inspiring others in health and nature, discovering our past and history, bring joy to those around him, and is a wonderful father and grandfather. 

    To help Michael is not just to help a man recover, but to help a community gain a friend's health back. Many of us are working together locally, and online, to bring Michael back on his feet with strength and energy: local fundraisers, radio shows to bring awareness to Michael's needs, and reaching out to hearts like yours to improve a man to help his community.

    It may seem like a small cause to you, but to Grand Junction, Colorado Michael means a whole lot more.

    Risks & Challenges

    No risks that we can think of and all the challenges are in Michael's path in recovery. You can help that path become easier.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Michael P.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!


    Thank you for your time, contribution, and/or donation. Michael and the rest of Grand Junction appreciate your giving nature!

story:
Sean's battle against Lung Cancer continues...

After six months of winning battles against the cancer, Sean began suffering from escalating back pain.  The oncologist wanted to do an early PET scan, but the insurance would only cover a CT scan, and Sean was diagnosed with Pneumonitis - inflammation of the lung - and was put on steroids to help his lung heal.  After a few more weeks of increasing pain, Sean was admitted into the hospital after a round of coughing left Sean in excruciating pain and trouble breathing.  The first thing they discovered was that Sean had been misdiagnosed with Pneumonitis, when he actually had Pneumonia!  The doctors took Sean off the steroids and put him on antibiotics, but the pain only kept getting worse.  Over a week after Sean was admitted to the hospital, they FINALLY ordered a full set of scans: MRI for the brain (at Sean's request), and PET scan for the rest of his body.  His pain symptoms had negative implications...

From Bad to Worse...

We knew something was horribly wrong by the expression on the doctors' faces.  Sean had a metastatic brain tumor.  The news was shocking but not tragic.  Gamma Knife radiation could take care of the tumor and leave the rest of Sean's brain intact.  
Then the PET scan results came back... the lung cancer had also metastasized into one of his ribs.  There is no simple and straightforward treatment for this one... only more chemo/radiation or experimental treatments.
A few days later Sean was released from the hospital on a cocktail of pain medications that have kept him mostly sedated.  Unfortunately, they haven't fully managed his pain, and he is still having intense pain on some days.

Going on from here...

Sean's Gamma-Knife radiation treatment will occur on Friday (6/27).  And his treatment for the cancer in his lung and rib will begin again a few weeks following.  We are trying the following things to help Sean:

  1. Looking into 3'rd Phase trials for Sean's particular cancer (Locally and also in the MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, Texas
  2. Looking into Naturopathic Medicine for Pain Relief (trying to get him off the narcotics)
  3. Adjusting Sean's diet to support Sean's natural immune system and general health.
  4.  Praying Praying Praying
I don't know how much the total out of pocket cost for Sean's treatment will be (it could be $15,000 or it could be $75,000), but I do know that most 3'rd Phase trials are NOT covered by insurance, and that Naturopathic pain management is also NOT covered by insurance (isn't it odd that insurance will pay for Methodone, Oxycontin, and Dilaudid but not for things found in NATURE!!!)
Thanks for your prayers, and any support you can give.  Please remember to pray for Sarah Trank, my sister in law, and Sean's amazing wife, who has been there with Sean and for Sean since this all started.
God Bless,
Aaron Trank

story:
Hello! My name is David McClintock and I am an Actor/Dancer and certified Pilates instructor through Power Pilates, the leading educator of classical Pilates. Currently certified in Beginner and Intermediate Mat Pilates, I would love to continue my education to become a full time Pilates instructor. 

As of now, my certifications limit me to group classes at local gyms or semi private in-home sessions, providing part time work. Many Pilates studios, often already staffed with proficient teachers, are hesitant to hire teachers with only Mat certifications due to the size of their studios. Most studios are small and equipped with apparatus' so trainers can cater to semi privates or privates on the machines. 


Total Cost of Comprehensive: $6000

As a pre-requisite students are required to attend a minimum of 25 apparatus sessions private or semi private with a classically trained instructor prior to the weekend. Each session can cost anywhere from $40-$70, that's a minimum of $1000 

When you register for the program you have three options -

EARLY BIRD DISCOUNT
$4995.00 $4795.00

or

Pay 50% Now and the remainder by Weekend 2 (plus a 5% administrative fee) $2747.25

or

Pay $1000 Now and split the remainder before Weekend 3 and the program's final Weekend (plus a 7% administrative fee) $1349.65

The Comprehensive training is the most extensive program and covers beginner, intermediate and advanced level exercises utilizing the Pilates apparatus – Mat, Reformer, Cadillac, Chair, Barrels, Ped-o-Pull and Magic Circle – as well as understanding how to work with Special Case clients. Students will sharpen your eye for subtle exercise modifications and master the ability to work with people of all ages and fitness levels at the same time. By completing this goal, I will be able to further explore my passion of Pilates and teaching, but also have the availability and time to pursue my other passions of dance and theatre as well.


    Risks & Challenges

    Though I have already paid and successfully completed two certifications on my own, the Comprehensive program is just too expensive when factoring in all the aspects of young adulthood. 

    I work three different jobs - I teach 13 Pilates classes around the city, I have a private Pilates clients, and I walk dogs. Though I make enough money to sustain life after rent, utilities, food, and commute costs are factored out, I am unable to save as much as I had hoped. Also, as an actor/dancer, it is imperative that I be involved with something artistic. Between working three jobs, I haven't had the opportunity to attend classes or auditions due to time and money constrictions. However, upon completion of my comprehensive I would be able to work full time while making my own hours. 

    Pilates is something that I am extremely passionate about. Every donation received will go towards the continuation of my Pilates education.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      No donation is too big or too small, but if you can't donate please share!

story:
Short Summary

The edge is just where we like to be.  The edge is immediate, challenging, and immensely rewarding.  Our founder, Dr. Roy Klossner, commenced building a vision he had to help the indigent in the Gainesville, FL area. 

The vision is to reach the underserved in the Tower Triangle between I-75, Tower Road (75th Street), Newberry and Archer Roads.   We rent a wonderful facility behind North Florida Regional Medical Center and have already partnered with an awesome group of doctors at Gainesville OBGYN.  Since Feb we have been seeing OB patients at our facility.  But this is only a slice of what Roy wants to do.  Roy wants to develop a clinic that will meet the needs of whole families.

Gainesville has the 5th highest income disparity gap in the country.  The area we are targeting contains 52% of residents labeled by the US gov't as indigent.  The need is tremendous.  People are trying to support families and have money aside for healthcare, but it simply isn't happening.  That is where joining us at Samaritan’s HealthCARE means you can make a difference.

Our goal is to be open 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. on weekdays.  This is a major undertaking that we can't do without your help.

What We Need & What You Get

What ever funds we receive go directly into the operating and day to day operations fund.  We will use your money for the following:

  • Medical supplies for the physicians and nurses ($12,000)
  • Office supplies for the office ($3,000)
  • Ultrasound machine to see the babies! ($30,000) 
  • Outfit a dental room with all the bells and whistles to serve our patients ($25,000)
  • Medicines and hope creating gifts for our patients ($10,000)
  • Wages and salaries for essential personnel ($40,000) although many of our providers are volunteers (over $190,000 dollars worth per annum), we need to pay some employees to keep the vision going.
  • You will see people impacted, lives changed, and hope given to those with serious need because of your gifts.

The Impact

Your generosity will lead stories like the following:

  • The Italian Lady.  In November of 2012 a retired woman from Italy came into our clinic.  She spoke broken English but indicated she had abnormal pain in her stomach.  She had been to the local emergency room and had visited another private practice provider.  The Italian lady, standing around 4 ft 3 inches, could afford no more and had no income stream to pay for further medical care.  Our doctors secured tests for her through our network and the tests indicated she had cancer.  She was treated locally and because of our referrals, care, prayer, and medical experts she is alive today.  Frequently, we receive letters or have return visits of people like the Italian lady who simply want to thank us for loving enough to provide the necessary care by listening and advocating for them.
  • Shot in the Gut Lady.  Recently a women volunteering for us was prescribed a medicine for her condition that was simply too expensive for her.  She was distraught when she asked for prayer for this critical medicine.  With IBS she was home bound and life had become difficult.  After praying about it, and on the next day, we searched our pharmaceutical fridge.  It happened that the day before, someone, a Catholic believer from Ohio, had sent us three months of this medicine for free!  We hadn't unwrapped the package yet, but God knew.  Because this person met the criteria for our clinic, we gave the medicine to her giving her some of her old way of life back.  She now has insurance and can get the medicine more affordably.  Samaritan's Clinic was there to get her through a difficult time in her life.
  • The Insulin Lady.  A muslim woman from Bangladesh came in to our clinic in desperate need of insulin.  She had become insulin resistant and was now using such an amount of insulin she could not afford to pay for even part of her prescription.  We asked if we could pray with her to receive the insulin as we didn't have what she needed and it was't very unlikely we would find the amount she needed.  The very next day a person called our clinic and said a local hospital was ending a study and wondered if we would like some insulin since we have a refrigerator.  The type and amount was EXACTLY what the insulin lady needed.  We were able to provide what she needed over the weekend.  Later our staff assisted in connecting her with a drug distribution program to help her get her required insulin for free.  She is now free of concern for her health because of our caring clinic staff.
  • We continue to have story after story when we have had a chance to help a person or family get through a difficult time until they are back on their feet.  Our goal is to provide loving, whole-body healthcare.  You can be part of our work through your generous giving.

Risks and Challenges

  • The greatest risk in our business is becoming callous.  Life can be messy and especially working with the most vulnerable and needy in society.  We are working day in and day out with people on the fringe and on the outskirts of life.  People who are working and trying to make it, who just need a boost or a stop gap measure, these are the people we want to help.  In the mix can be individuals who don't care about others or expect ongoing handouts.  We want to serve all people without judging.  We want to love without borders.
  • To overcome callousness, we need to be a place of grace and love.  We need to be mentally solid, encouraging others to be better, more caring and equally sacrificial.  In group, we can serve better.  Prayer is also a priority in our clinic.  We want to offer hope by seeing bodies healed.  We also want to offer ongoing, unquenching hope, that is the hope for a better tomorrow.  This hope comes in pieces.  The providers, nurses, check-in and check-out folks need to be all over hope.  We want to provide free or low cost essentials from shampoo, soap, and toothbrushes to diapers, blankets, and wipes.  We want to pray for and encourage those hurting and sick.  We will overcome callousness because we have the hope in us.  By partnering with us you bring hope too!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Yeah, money helps, but not everyone can give or wants to give money alone.  Here are some tangible ways to partner without worrying about your pocket book:
  • Pray for us
  • Send baby or mommy blankets
  • Give your extra hotel shampoos, soaps, give-aways that are cluttering your closets
  • Email us for a list of additional items you may be interested in providing contact Brittney at Brittney@samhealthcare.org
  • Volunteer if you live in the Gainesville area
  • WE NEED PROVIDERS!!!  If you are one and want to join us, contact us!
  • If our story resonates with you, help us get the word out and make some noise about our fund-raising campaign on your social networks
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

We continue to have story after story when we have had a chance to help a person or family get through a difficult time until they are back on their feet.  Our goal is to provide loving, whole-body healthcare.  You can be part of our work through your generous giving.




Risks and Challenges

The greatest risk in our business is becoming callous.  Life can be messy and especially working with the most vulnerable and needy in society.  We are working day in and day out with people on the fringe and on the outskirts of life.  People who are working and trying to make it, who just need a boost or a stop gap measure, these are the people we want to help.  In the mix can be individuals who don't care about others or expect ongoing handouts.  We want to serve all people without judging.  We want to love without borders.

 To overcome callousness, we need to be a place of grace and love.  We need to be mentally solid, encouraging others to be better, more caring and equally sacrificial.  In group, we can serve better.  Prayer is also a priority in our clinic.  We want to offer hope by seeing bodies healed.  We also want to offer ongoing, unquenching hope, that is the hope for a better tomorrow.  This hope comes in pieces.  The providers, nurses, check-in and check-out folks need to be all over hope.  We want to provide free or low cost essentials from shampoo, soap, and toothbrushes to diapers, blankets, and wipes.  We want to pray for and encourage those hurting and sick.  We will overcome callousness because we have the hope in us.  By partnering with us you bring hope too!


Other Ways You Can Help
Yeah, money helps, but not everyone can give or wants to give money alone.  Here are some tangible ways to partner without worrying about your pocket book:

Pray for us
Send baby or mommy blankets
Give your extra hotel shampoos, soaps, give-aways that are cluttering your closets
Email us for a list of additional items you may be interested in providing contact Brittney at Brittney@samhealthcare.org
Volunteer if you live in the Gainesville area
WE NEED PROVIDERS!!!  If you are one and want to join us, contact us!
If our story resonates with you, help us get the word out and make some noise about our fund-raising campaign on your social networks Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Urgent Care In Your Pocket

We envision a world where everyone has easy and affordable access to health care. With on-demand house calls, 24/7 phone & video support, and 24/7 chat support, you can have a health care provider at your fingertips 24/7.



What is TrueCare24?


That can be a lot to digest, so let's break it down below!


Why Are We Building TrueCare24?




We envision a world where everyone can have access to affordable and high quality care, whenever and wherever!


Doctors aren't always available right away

  • 1/3 of people have difficulties arranging a prompt appointment with a doctor. In fact, the average wait time to see a physician in 2014 was 18.5 days.
  • You would never book an urgent care appointment days in advance.
Traveling to a doctor's office may be difficult
  • We've all been through it. Some days you can be so sick that you may not be able to travel or maybe you have some pain that restricts your commute. 
  • Many of us have kids, and we can't simply leave them at home alone!
  • What about our parents and grandparents? Many elders aren't able to travel to doctors' offices.
Emergency Rooms can be inefficient in terms of time and costs
  • Imagine waiting for 6 hours in an ER and realizing you didn't need an ER check up, Then you get stuck with a bill for hundreds or even thousands of dollars!
  • 2/3rd of visits happen during non-working hours and only 13% lead to hospitalization.


What Types of Care Can TrueCare24 Provide?




Urgent Care

  • Our caregivers can treat injuries, illnesses, and minor skin conditions that disrupt your day.
  • We treat all sorts of conditions including cold & flu, allergies, sore throat, and many more! (NOTE: Some conditions are only treatable through house calls, while others can be treated both in-person as well as over our phone/video/chat support.

Primary Care

  • Whether it's for school, camp, or employment, our caregivers can provide vaccinations, physicals, and medical screenings.

Pediatrics

  • That's right, we treat adults AND children! No more sitting in a waiting room when your child is sick.

Lab Tests & Medications

  • Our caregivers travel with a mobile lab that provides lab results, an EKG machine, IV supplies, suture kits and splinting materials
  • Everything you need to get better is brought to you, including commonly prescribed medications. No more waiting in line at the pharmacy when you're sick or in pain!

How Does TrueCare24 Work?


1. Search your zip code and select "child" or "adult"




2. Choose your caregiver. Each one will have a description of their experience/background, average user rating, and estimated arrival time.

      



3. Once you select your provider, you are given an estimated time of arrival and a map showing the provider's location.



What Are Some of TrueCare24's Customers Saying?





Our satisfied customers can attest to the fact that TrueCare24 ensures that happiness and health go hand-in-hand!


Who Is The Team Behind TrueCare24?




Founding Executives

  

As the two co-founders of TrueCare24, Leo (CEO) and Bimohit (CTO) are working towards bringing affordable and accessible health care to all. Leo has had over 10 years of experience in consumer packaged goods and web service industries, while Bimohit has had over a decade of experience in designing, developing, and scaling enterprise class services and products in the technology space. Our co-founders hold degrees from world-class institutions such as the UC Berkeley Haas School of Business and the University of Pennsylvania!


Founding M.D.'s

 

Two of our founding team members include Kelly Huibregtse, M.D., and Caesar Djavaherian, M.D. Kelly is a pediatrician and has won several awards for her excellence in the study of health problems and leadership in medicine. In addition, she has been given grants and scholarships to focus on health problems in children. Caesar has years of experience as an M.D. and an ER physician. Caesar has innovated health care delivery by founding ERDirect and Direct Urgent Care. 


Senior Software Engineer



As the Senior Software Engineer, Eugene Berdnikov is a crucial part of our founding team. He has over 6 years of experience in the software development industry, and has also been involved with the creation of several applications like ApperCode and MobileNoter. 


How Can I Help TrueCare24 & What Do I Get In Return?

By contributing to our campaign, you'll help us move closer towards a world with personalized and affordable health care! Backers receive a range of perks, from stress toys to free house calls and telemedicine subscriptions. Check out what you can get for each reward tier below:
In addition, anyone that donates $15 or more will receive an exclusive TrueCare24 anti-stress toy! You can choose between a physician or a smartphone. Check them out below:

                                     



FAQ

Where does TrueCare24 currently operate?

For house calls, we currently operate in San Francisco, Oakland, and Berkeley, California. 

Do you plan on expanding to other areas?

Of course! We're starting small and perfecting our process in select cities in California, but we'll be expanding over time. Our mission is to bring health care to the world's fingertips, not just Californians!

For Phone/Video/Chat Care (Telemedicine), which locations are supported?

We operate our Telemedicine feature everywhere in the United States!

If I have a question about your company, who can I call?

Phone: (628)-333-2005; Email: support@truecare24.com

Do you only have doctors on your platform, or other providers as well?

We have Doctors, Nurse Practitioners, and Physician Assistants.

How much does the service cost? 

We have 2 pricing plans:

  • $199/house call (includes complimentary 1-month telemedicine)
  • $99/house call + 24/7 telemedicine for $15/month
Also, we accept Medicare and HSA.

Are there any hidden fees or expenses?
Nope! We have flat rate fees & monthly subscriptions. No hidden costs.

Can my TrueCare24 provider write prescriptions?
Yes!
