story:
Introduction

uRADMonitor means two things: IOT devices equipped with sensors for Air Quality monitoring of cities, offices and homes and a global network of such devices spread in more than 40 countries that generate uniform and comparable Environmental data so we can understand the big picture on pollution.

The entire uRADMonitor effort fights to solve pollution at global level. I  am grateful for all the community support the project received so far: this includes the first successfully funded indieGogo campaign and all the uRADMonitor adopters that helped to create a global uRADMonitor network 800 units in size. Last but not least, visionary people involved in responsible corporations, helped this effort even further.

Our first IndieGogo campaign was a success

Personally I am committed to building something that matters, that has an impact on the lives of many.  Air Quality has a direct impact on the health and the environment, and the first step in solving the pollution problem is to understand it. Here is where uRADMonitor steps in.

The uRADMonitor A3

The project evolved not only in size, but also in number of products developed. The uRADMonitor A3 is probably the best uRADMonitor product developed so far, proving excellent reliability during exploitation. It is packed with an impressive number of high quality sensors that were selected after intensive research and testing:

A3 internals and one finished unit

Each A3 measures 8 air parameters with a significant effect on our health and the environment: temperature, pressure, humidity, volatile organic compounds, formaldehyde, carbon dioxide, particulate matter PM2.5 and ionising radiation. See complete specs in the technical datasheet.

Powerful dashboard allows easy data visualisation

The devices come in four variants, with the same sensors but with four different connectivity options to make installation and deployment easier in homes, offices or cities. These four connectivity variants include Ethernet, Wifi, GSM and LoRaWAN:

Four distinct A3 variants with multiple connectivity options

For this campaign I am offering the A3 with Ethernet and the A3 with Wifi, you can choose any.

Orange Romania supported the direction contoured by uRADMonitor and facilitated the deployment of almost 100x A3 units in five Romanian cities. The devices were installed in public transportation, in smart busses equipped with mobile Internet connectivity, so large city areas could be mapped easily. This resulted in valuable air quality data, with an impact on more than 3 million people living there.

Live Air Quality data from Alba Iulia using 15 uRADMonitor A3 units

 

Health impact

The sensors in the A3 were picked to cover an extended list of dangerous pollutants, that appear both indoors and outdoors:

  • VOC or volatile organic compounds are a class of substances that evaporate at room temperature. Being different substances may be responsible for a broad category of disorders, including respiratory problems, allergic or weakening immunity in children. Some VOC ‘s are responsible for the formation of smog, irritation of eyes, nose and throat, headaches and concentration problems. In extreme circumstances, more severe complications can occur, such as damage to liver, kidney and central nervous system or cancer. Read more.

  • Particulate matter PM2.5 refers to small particles with a diameter of up to 2.5 microns. These particles can penetrate deep into the lungs , causing allergies, respiratory and cardiovascular diseases . The A3 detects them with a high quality laser scattering sensor. More details on health effects here.

  • Ionizing radiation is harmful to living organisms because it can cause damage to cells that can result in multiple disorders, the most common of which is cancer. Ionizing radiation is naturally occurring from cosmic and terrestrial sources, but  there are also artificial generators related to nuclear activities or x-ray devices . More on this here.
  • Formaldehyde is a toxic colorless gas with a pungent smell, that results from the burning of carbon based materials. It can be found in forest fires, in automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. It is an allergenic and a known carcinogenic compound that can cause serious health effects, depending on concentration and exposure. Even in tiny quantities just it can irritate the eyes and nose, and can worsen asthma symptoms. More info.
  • Carbon dioxide is a gas heavier than air. In small quantities of up to 5000ppm (0.5% ) can cause headaches, lethargy, slowing of intellectual ability, irritability, sleep disturbance. In larger quantities can cause dizziness, loss of sight, hearing or knowledge. Read more.

 

Poverty, pollution and many health issues

Apparently things are on an ascending trend, however there’s an issue: The network distribution is not uniform, with a predominant presence in more developed countries. These places have better regulations on environmental protection. Except industry and traffic there’s an (economically) sustained effort to limit dangers to human health. On the other hand, less developed areas are lacking proper regulations and pollution control. The uRADMonitor network is practically inexistent here due reasons unrelated to awareness and will, but rather to costs.

Crop stubble being burnt in India. The smoke settles on major cities creating layers of smog

Traditional Bricks Field in Bangladesh, pumping huge amounts of PM particles 

Picture named "China exports Air Pollution" to highlight the dramatic pollution situation

Just another day in traffic, India

If you think these are problems of places far away, think again! We share the planet and even more - we breathe the same air. And air travels quickly as the wind. Here's the smoke from the crop fires in India pictured from space (picture credit NASA):

Various local sources are contributing to global pollution levels and global warming

Polluted air killed half a million people in Europe prematurely in 2014, according to a report on air quality from the European Environment Agency in Copenhagen, Denmark: “Air pollution is the single largest environmental health risk in Europe,” says the EEA.

By far the biggest killer was PM2.5, the soup of tiny particles measuring 2.5 micrometres across or less. These claimed an estimated 428,000 premature deaths across the 41 European countries tracked in 2014. The main source, contributing 57 per cent of PM2.5 emissions in 2015, was domestic wood burning, especially in eastern Europe.

Air pollution is the single largest environmental health risk in Europe

“Heart disease and stroke are the most common reasons for premature death attributable to air pollution, and are responsible for 80 per cent of cases,” the EEA report says. Air pollution also contributes to other respiratory diseases and cancer, and has non-lethal impacts on diabetes, Alzheimer’s disease, pregnancy and brain development in children.

 

Proposal 

It’s not enough to guard the cities of a few regions of the planet. Pollution is a global phenomenon impacting each and all of us, as air and water know no boundaries.

It is our shared responsibility to address this situation: get the single A3 perk, you support uRADMonitor and the project  expands.  Or instead, get the double perk with two A3 units, ones goes to you to monitor your home environment while the other is donated to a school, to a person or a location of your choice. This way you are directly making an impact on pollution - exactly where this phenomenon is more pronounced. 

I made the perks in such a way so that everyone contributes: you, me, the donation beneficiary. You can see the retail cost of the A3 here. There's the Early Bird perk with 30% off (limited), the Single A3 Perk with 10% off, or the Double A3 Perk with 20% off. These discounts are uRADMonitor's contribution beyond the production itself, to support those in need, with your help.

 

The production stage

During the previous successful Indiegogo campaign I learned that production can be difficult, especially when there are 3 different products on the roll. I wanted to simplify things and did my homework before starting this campaign. The A3 is now at its 5th iteration. This means I refined it for the best possible hardware. Although a new product, the production line is already in place to supply a high volume of units to meet the demand:

Production batch of uRADMonitor A3 units ready to ship

The production is split between Romania and China for PCBs, sensors, assembly, testing or various components. I went for outsourcing some of the manufacturing parts so I can delegate the more time consuming work and be able to focus on the project direction. I do all R&D, product development, software development, backend development in Romania. Delegating parts of the manufacturing to China helps to reduce costs and it was a key element to get this project this far.

First batch. Preparing for some intense work

Lots of uRADMonitor A3 units before shipping

 

Delivery

The units can either be delivered from Romania, Europe (for European customers either provide a valid VATID or add 19% for Romanian VAT) or directly from the production line in China (no other tax added, you would pay customs fee on import if any):

Shipping high volume uRADMonitor units from China

The main purpose of this campaign is to extend coverage in places with pollution issues. Important here is the double perk, that gets you one A3 unit, while the other is donated to someone commonly agreed. There are more then 3000 requests for uRADMonitor units from places all over the world. I will discuss with the backers individually where the donations should go. The sponsor and the beneficiary should stay in  contact - my plan is to structure this communication properly via the uRADMonitor forum or some other similar way. Your suggestions will be very useful here. 

When backing your perks, please indicate the A3 type you are interested in (Ethernet or Wifi) based on how is easier for you to connect it.

 

Campaign Timeline

Everything is in place so the production will follow immediately after the campaign ends. March 2018 is reserved for the organisational details, identifying the best destination for the donated units. Right after all units will be delivered, according to the following timeline:

"Uniform Data - Uniform Rights" uRADMonitor A3 campaign schedule

 

Thank you

For the previous indieGogo campaign I invested unforeseen time and effort to push the deliverables up to the end, so the project could grow to return something useful to the global community. With proven dedication,  I trust that I can rely on the indieGogo community to solve one of the greatest challenges impacting us, our families, our world. I want to conclude by showing my gratitude for your support so far: thank you! 

Let's deploy 100x more A3 units together!

Me, after soldering and assembling a large batch of A3 units
story_txt:
IntroductionuRADMonitor means two things: IOT devices equipped with sensors for Air Quality monitoring of cities, offices and homes and a global network of such devices spread in more than 40 countries that generate uniform and comparable Environmental data so we can understand the big picture on pollution.The entire uRADMonitor effort fights to solve pollution at global level. I  am grateful for all the community support the project received so far: this includes the first successfully funded indieGogo campaign and all the uRADMonitor adopters that helped to create a global uRADMonitor network 800 units in size. Last but not least, visionary people involved in responsible corporations, helped this effort even further.Our first IndieGogo campaign was a successPersonally I am committed to building something that matters, that has an impact on the lives of many.  Air Quality has a direct impact on the health and the environment, and the first step in solving the pollution problem is to understand it. Here is where uRADMonitor steps in.The uRADMonitor A3The project evolved not only in size, but also in number of products developed. The uRADMonitor A3 is probably the best uRADMonitor product developed so far, proving excellent reliability during exploitation. It is packed with an impressive number of high quality sensors that were selected after intensive research and testing:A3 internals and one finished unitEach A3 measures 8 air parameters with a significant effect on our health and the environment: temperature, pressure, humidity, volatile organic compounds, formaldehyde, carbon dioxide, particulate matter PM2.5 and ionising radiation. See complete specs in the technical datasheet.Powerful dashboard allows easy data visualisationThe devices come in four variants, with the same sensors but with four different connectivity options to make installation and deployment easier in homes, offices or cities. These four connectivity variants include Ethernet, Wifi, GSM and LoRaWAN:Four distinct A3 variants with multiple connectivity optionsFor this campaign I am offering the A3 with Ethernet and the A3 with Wifi, you can choose any.Orange Romania supported the direction contoured by uRADMonitor and facilitated the deployment of almost 100x A3 units in five Romanian cities. The devices were installed in public transportation, in smart busses equipped with mobile Internet connectivity, so large city areas could be mapped easily. This resulted in valuable air quality data, with an impact on more than 3 million people living there.Live Air Quality data from Alba Iulia using 15 uRADMonitor A3 units Health impactThe sensors in the A3 were picked to cover an extended list of dangerous pollutants, that appear both indoors and outdoors:

VOC or volatile organic compounds are a class of substances that evaporate at room temperature. Being different substances may be responsible for a broad category of disorders, including respiratory problems, allergic or weakening immunity in children. Some VOC ‘s are responsible for the formation of smog, irritation of eyes, nose and throat, headaches and concentration problems. In extreme circumstances, more severe complications can occur, such as damage to liver, kidney and central nervous system or cancer. Read more.
Particulate matter PM2.5 refers to small particles with a diameter of up to 2.5 microns. These particles can penetrate deep into the lungs , causing allergies, respiratory and cardiovascular diseases . The A3 detects them with a high quality laser scattering sensor. More details on health effects here.

Ionizing radiation is harmful to living organisms because it can cause damage to cells that can result in multiple disorders, the most common of which is cancer. Ionizing radiation is naturally occurring from cosmic and terrestrial sources, but  there are also artificial generators related to nuclear activities or x-ray devices . More on this here.

Formaldehyde is a toxic colorless gas with a pungent smell, that results from the burning of carbon based materials. It can be found in forest fires, in automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. It is an allergenic and a known carcinogenic compound that can cause serious health effects, depending on concentration and exposure. Even in tiny quantities just it can irritate the eyes and nose, and can worsen asthma symptoms. More info.

Carbon dioxide is a gas heavier than air. In small quantities of up to 5000ppm (0.5% ) can cause headaches, lethargy, slowing of intellectual ability, irritability, sleep disturbance. In larger quantities can cause dizziness, loss of sight, hearing or knowledge. Read more.
 Poverty, pollution and many health issuesApparently things are on an ascending trend, however there’s an issue: The network distribution is not uniform, with a predominant presence in more developed countries. These places have better regulations on environmental protection. Except industry and traffic there’s an (economically) sustained effort to limit dangers to human health. On the other hand, less developed areas are lacking proper regulations and pollution control. The uRADMonitor network is practically inexistent here due reasons unrelated to awareness and will, but rather to costs.Crop stubble being burnt in India. The smoke settles on major cities creating layers of smogTraditional Bricks Field in Bangladesh, pumping huge amounts of PM particles Picture named "China exports Air Pollution" to highlight the dramatic pollution situationJust another day in traffic, IndiaIf you think these are problems of places far away, think again! We share the planet and even more - we breathe the same air. And air travels quickly as the wind. Here's the smoke from the crop fires in India pictured from space (picture credit NASA):Various local sources are contributing to global pollution levels and global warmingPolluted air killed half a million people in Europe prematurely in 2014, according to a report on air quality from the European Environment Agency in Copenhagen, Denmark: “Air pollution is the single largest environmental health risk in Europe,” says the EEA.By far the biggest killer was PM2.5, the soup of tiny particles measuring 2.5 micrometres across or less. These claimed an estimated 428,000 premature deaths across the 41 European countries tracked in 2014. The main source, contributing 57 per cent of PM2.5 emissions in 2015, was domestic wood burning, especially in eastern Europe.Air pollution is the single largest environmental health risk in Europe“Heart disease and stroke are the most common reasons for premature death attributable to air pollution, and are responsible for 80 per cent of cases,” the EEA report says. Air pollution also contributes to other respiratory diseases and cancer, and has non-lethal impacts on diabetes, Alzheimer’s disease, pregnancy and brain development in children. Proposal It’s not enough to guard the cities of a few regions of the planet. Pollution is a global phenomenon impacting each and all of us, as air and water know no boundaries. It is our shared responsibility to address this situation: get the single A3 perk, you support uRADMonitor and the project  expands.  Or instead, get the double perk with two A3 units, ones goes to you to monitor your home environment while the other is donated to a school, to a person or a location of your choice. This way you are directly making an impact on pollution - exactly where this phenomenon is more pronounced. I made the perks in such a way so that everyone contributes: you, me, the donation beneficiary. You can see the retail cost of the A3 here. There's the Early Bird perk with 30% off (limited), the Single A3 Perk with 10% off, or the Double A3 Perk with 20% off. These discounts are uRADMonitor's contribution beyond the production itself, to support those in need, with your help. The production stageDuring the previous successful Indiegogo campaign I learned that production can be difficult, especially when there are 3 different products on the roll. I wanted to simplify things and did my homework before starting this campaign. The A3 is now at its 5th iteration. This means I refined it for the best possible hardware. Although a new product, the production line is already in place to supply a high volume of units to meet the demand:Production batch of uRADMonitor A3 units ready to shipThe production is split between Romania and China for PCBs, sensors, assembly, testing or various components. I went for outsourcing some of the manufacturing parts so I can delegate the more time consuming work and be able to focus on the project direction. I do all R&D, product development, software development, backend development in Romania. Delegating parts of the manufacturing to China helps to reduce costs and it was a key element to get this project this far.First batch. Preparing for some intense workLots of uRADMonitor A3 units before shipping DeliveryThe units can either be delivered from Romania, Europe (for European customers either provide a valid VATID or add 19% for Romanian VAT) or directly from the production line in China (no other tax added, you would pay customs fee on import if any):Shipping high volume uRADMonitor units from ChinaThe main purpose of this campaign is to extend coverage in places with pollution issues. Important here is the double perk, that gets you one A3 unit, while the other is donated to someone commonly agreed. There are more then 3000 requests for uRADMonitor units from places all over the world. I will discuss with the backers individually where the donations should go. The sponsor and the beneficiary should stay in  contact - my plan is to structure this communication properly via the uRADMonitor forum or some other similar way. Your suggestions will be very useful here. When backing your perks, please indicate the A3 type you are interested in (Ethernet or Wifi) based on how is easier for you to connect it. Campaign TimelineEverything is in place so the production will follow immediately after the campaign ends. March 2018 is reserved for the organisational details, identifying the best destination for the donated units. Right after all units will be delivered, according to the following timeline:"Uniform Data - Uniform Rights" uRADMonitor A3 campaign schedule Thank youFor the previous indieGogo campaign I invested unforeseen time and effort to push the deliverables up to the end, so the project could grow to return something useful to the global community. With proven dedication,  I trust that I can rely on the indieGogo community to solve one of the greatest challenges impacting us, our families, our world. I want to conclude by showing my gratitude for your support so far: thank you! Let's deploy 100x more A3 units together!Me, after soldering and assembling a large batch of A3 units

story:
Wellmade Restorative Superfood Smoothie Booster Blends

Hi! I am Amy Sichmeller.  I would describe myself as a spunky health and wellness enthusiast, chef, cookbook author, runner, mom, Fitbit wearer, and Instagram lover.  Through my pursuit to overcome my own health obstacles, I created a variety of superfood blends to support my efforts.  After months of enjoying daily smoothies with my nutritionally enhanced superfood smoothie boosters, I decided to produce a wellness product line so others could benefit as well!

Wellmade Restorative Superfood Smoothie Boosters have been designed to add effortless nutritional benefits to your favorite smoothies.  Each booster is condition specific that focuses on inflammation, gut and skin health.

The condition specific blends have been nutritionally designed to maximize your wellness routine.  Enhance your body's ability to function at it’s very best with the addition of superfoods such as chia, hemp, collagen, moringa, cacao and turmeric.  Each ingredient is in powder form for maximum blending ability. 

Simply add a scoop of the nutritionally dense superfood blend to your smoothie without the fuss of purchasing and measuring multiple ingredients.  All ingredients are sourced by premium suppliers and will be manufactured in an FDA registered facility. 

How is this different from what’s available currently on the market?

Most smoothie boosters on the market today are protein based.  Personally, I do not care for the texture that these protein powders add to my smoothie nor do I want the addition of flavorings, sweeteners or other ingredients that I am not comfortable putting into my body.  

What do I want in a smoothie?

I want to taste the freshness of fruits and vegetables!  No chalkiness with the Wellmade Restorative blends or strange aftertastes.  All ingredients are 100% natural, FDA approved and linked to positive benefits such as warding off cancer, heart disease, inflammation and more!

What We Need From You & What You Get

To make this project come to life and be able to spread the message of good health and wellness, I need help.  Start up costs are a real thing and it is not easy for the average “Jane” to make a dream a reality.

As a self-published cookbook author and Chef at a local cafe, I have taken on start-up projects that resulted in successful outcomes.  This project is on a larger scale and requires more financial backing. 

All funding will go directly to the costs of materials, manufacturing, design and nutritional content testing (required to obtain a nutrition label on the products).  

Impact

My goal is to create a natural foods product line that supports health and wellness with the intention to expand on the varieties offered and later to create additional products to add to your wellness ritual. 

Initially the smoothie boosters will be sold via the Wellmade Restorative website with plans to be placed in grocery stores, health food stores and more. 

Risks and Challenges

The largest obstacle is obtaining the necessary monetary requirements to begin manufacturing. Once manufacturing has begun, the products will be available for shipping in approximately 12 weeks.

Additional challenges will be creating a marketing campaign to advertise on a large scale.  I plan to collaborate with professionals in this field to maximize the visibility of the brand. 

Other Ways to Help

If you cannot financially contribute to the campaign, please SHARE! Spread the word!

Use the Indiegogo share button!

story:
With the new models come new materials! 

We have chosen a new composite material with glass fiber, this special plastic blend translates into better mechanical properties especially in terms of elasticity and tensile strength.

Moreover, we are very excited to present you the first SPIRGRIPS® made with an innovative Carbon mixture. Lighter, stronger and stiffer as never before!
 


 


 

This position has a huge impact on the cyclist's comfort by reducing joint and muscle pain.
 


 


 

 No matter if you are a pro or an amateur, if you climb mountains or just bike to work: SPIRGRIPS® + are easy to install on a wide range of bikes and you can benefit from them also biking just for few kilometers.
 


 


 

Numerous prototypes have been tested using the latest 3D printing technologies to validate the ergonomics of the new handle and ensuring its perfect integration on the handlebars available on the market.

SPIRGRIPS® + are the result of more than 10 years of research. These small bar grips are developed, tested, and scientifically validated in Switzerland in collaboration with professional cyclists.
 

VALIDATED BY SCIENCE


 

REDUCES VIBRATION IN ORDER TO PREVENT JOINT PAIN


NATURALLY ALIGN THE WRIST WITH THE ARM


 


 


 

We really care about ergonomics of course, but we never forget your safety. That's why we implemented the o-shape in order to prevent you from slipping, maintaining access to the brake every time.
 


 


 

During the past years we had the chance to study the best materials for SPIRGRIPS® +, we have done several tests in order to reach these results and we are very excited to present you the new era of SPIRGRIPS® +.
 


 


 

The shape - patented in Europe, the US and in China - is designed to correct the position of the hands, naturally aligning the joints of the forearms. Hand position has a huge impact on the cyclist's comfort and it's key in preventing joint and muscle pain.
 


 


 

SPIRGRIPS® + is easy to mount. You just need a hex key. And your bike, of course.

Fits: handlebars of racing bike, MTB, city bike with a diameter range between 22.2mm (0.87") and 31.8mm (1.25").

Weight: the estimated weight is below 70 gr for the composite version and approx 50gr for the carbon one.



 


 


 

The pad is the novelty of the new model, its purpose is to give greater ergonomics and adapt more into the cyclist's hand. That’s why we realized this part with a low Shore material, very soft to the touch it will really turns every bike ride into true comfort.

The pad can also be removed for saving more weight and increase the performances.



 


 


 


We have developed an improved plastic blend with glass fiber. This special type of glass fiber translates into better mechanical properties especially in terms of elasticity and tensile strength.




The product will be matte black.


The carbon model is 40% lighter, it is stronger and stiffer while maintaining the same mechanical properties. It's made with a special blend with carbon fiber, making it the best choice for anyone seeking higher performances.




Lobke Nijhoff - Pro cyclist


"The feeling I have when using SPIRGRIPS is relaxed. It takes the tension off the muscles in my arms. Because I like to travel long distances, I get less tired!"


Maxime Saonit — Pro MTB cyclist


"SPIRGRIPS, an object that has become essential for me on the World Marathon Series Events."


Gaia Ravaioli - 24H Solo Wembo World Champion 2017


"Since I've started using SPIRGRIPS my wrists thank you!"
 


Frans Claes - Belgian Champion 2015 & 2016
 

"SPIRGRIPS helps me in my performance at races and gives my hands a more relaxing position while riding my bike."
 

Christian Jupillat - UCI Masters Cyclo-Cross Senior World Champion


"I had the chance to test most of the innovations related to mountain biking. SPIRGRIPS impressed me with their comfort and thanks to them I've improved my performance every year. Having them on my bike is just essential, they are always with me. SPIRGRIPS + will be undoubtedly an innovation in lightness and comfort, I can't wait to try them."




Life is colorful and so it could be your new SPIRGRIPS +!


So, what's your favorite color?






Pascal Badolett is a physiotherapist, he lives and works in Geneva, Switzerland, and he is very passionate about sports, especially cycling. In 2007, after a long ride with his MTB he experienced wrists and back pain. During his job, he noticed that many cyclists complained about the same issue after their training sessions, also noticing that many of them changed very often their hand's positions on the handlebars. From this intuition the idea of creating a new concept of handles bar that really helps cyclists in a more ergonomics and innovative way. Our mission is to correct your position ensuring the best ergonomics and safety in a way never experienced before. 

Join the SPIRGRIPS revolution, change the way you bike for good. 

 


 


 


 

SPIRGRIPS® + are the result of more than ten years of research. These inner bar grips are developed, tested, and scientifically validated in Switzerland in collaboration with professional cyclists. Numerous prototypes have been tested using the latest 3D printing technologies to validate the ergonomics of the new handle and ensuring its perfect integration on the handlebars available on the market. 
 


 


 


 


 


 

NEW SHIPPING RATES

 


 

Worldwide shipping available!  After the campaign, we will send a survey to all our backers in order to collect the diameter chosen and the shipping details. Shipping will be charged only after the campaign.  It is variable for every country and depends on the number of pledges made for each country, that's why we prefer to not make you pay in advance. We will give you the exact shipping rates and charge you just the right amount! We already can provide accurate estimates and we would do our best to not get rates higher than these.

story:
Sport X1 STABILIZER

We created electronic stabilizer that fits your lifestyle, run, jump, walk, cycling or even riding a bike, share your videos like never before.  We innovate and transform your experience and bring the creativity in you to the next level the sky is the limit.

 

New version Sport X1

  • It is smaller.
  • Lighter.
  • and the biggest advantage is more stable than the old X1.

Stabilizing the videos has never been easier. Go beyond and turn your smartphone or action camera into a professional video camera using SPORT X1 stabilizer.

 

About SPORT X1 stabilizer.

Dynamic shooting 
SPORT X1 is built for extreme sports lovers. It stabilizes the video footage horizontally, without sacrificing the thrill of dynamic motion in the video. 

Incredibly compact 
World's smallest - only 70mm in length. World's lightest - only 185gm. And the world first wearable gimbal. 

A.I. stabilized 
With the self-propriety A.I. technology, the automatic calibration can be completed in a touch of a button. The weight parameter of your phone or GoPro camera will be recorded and calibrated by the device. 

Perfect match with GoPro 
Sport X1 is perfectly designed to fit all GoPro mount, ranging from helmet, bike, chest and pole mount. It is engineered to fit GoPro with the transparent protective case. 

Dual compatibility multi purpose 
SPORT X1 is uniquely designed with a retractable clips to fit either GoPro Hero 3+4,or smartphone. With the selfie stick installed, it is a perfect tool to shoot video selfie. The selfie stick, camera and smartphone doesn't come with it

 

Specification:

Model: SPORT X1 :Applicationfor sports cameras and smartphones

Dimension: L70 W64 H47mm

Weight: 185g

Battery type: Lipo battery

Battery spec: 550 mAh, 3.7V

Operating time: continuously 120-180mins under normal temperature

Charging time: 120mins

Operating temp: -10 to 40 degree Celcius

Operating angle: 360 degree in both horizontal and tilt axis

Includes:

•1 * Gimbal (with Battery)
•1 * USB Charger
•1 * Protection package 

 

What are the shipping and customs fees? ***NOTE*** 

Shipping fees are between €15 - 35 depending on your perks. We will send anywhere in the world. All international shipments are subject to duties, taxes and clearing fees which you are responsible for paying. All indiegogo rewards will be declared 'gifts', however, most countries will assess duties/taxes and in certain countries the carrier will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later. If you refuse delivery, your package will be abandoned. Once abandoned, we can’t ship another package to you.

Risks & Challenges

Like any hardware project, there are risks and challenges associated with manufacturing and supply chain logistics. There is always a chance that unexpected changes or issues may arise during execution impacting the delivery schedule.

The only risk we can think of is the projected timeline of the delivery of rewards. There may be unforeseen challenges when we start production. If any issues come up, the delivery of your reward will be delayed.

Zombie apocalypse or a very large meteorite hitting the earth ;p Everything is ready to go. All we need is your support.

That said, we’re pretty straight forward when it comes to communication and have built a reputation of being transparent with our backers. We'll make two promises:

  • We will deliver the highest quality product to each and every single backer. We take extreme pride in making some of the best products in the world and will never compromise on quality.
  • We will keep the lines of communication open at all times. If we have hurdles, you'll be the first to know about them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks in advance! Any help is welcome.
story_txt:
Sport X1 STABILIZER
We created electronic stabilizer that fits your lifestyle, run, jump, walk, cycling or even riding a bike, share your videos like never before.  We innovate and transform your experience and bring the creativity in you to the next level the sky is the limit.

 
New version Sport X1

It is smaller.
Lighter.
and the biggest advantage is more stable than the old X1.

Stabilizing the videos has never been easier. Go beyond and turn your smartphone or action camera into a professional video camera using SPORT X1 stabilizer.

 
About SPORT X1 stabilizer.
Dynamic shooting SPORT X1 is built for extreme sports lovers. It stabilizes the video footage horizontally, without sacrificing the thrill of dynamic motion in the video. Incredibly compact World's smallest - only 70mm in length. World's lightest - only 185gm. And the world first wearable gimbal. A.I. stabilized With the self-propriety A.I. technology, the automatic calibration can be completed in a touch of a button. The weight parameter of your phone or GoPro camera will be recorded and calibrated by the device. Perfect match with GoPro Sport X1 is perfectly designed to fit all GoPro mount, ranging from helmet, bike, chest and pole mount. It is engineered to fit GoPro with the transparent protective case. Dual compatibility multi purpose SPORT X1 is uniquely designed with a retractable clips to fit either GoPro Hero 3+4,or smartphone. With the selfie stick installed, it is a perfect tool to shoot video selfie. The selfie stick, camera and smartphone doesn't come with it

story:
Foxes with Moustaches!

We also want to share our understanding of quidditch and foxy team soul with other teams in the tournament. As a fox family, we want to be the best team in our region, and we know that it is not an easy job. But we believe that if we can find the opportunity to attend BMT, we may improve our skills due to reach our goal. We also want to represent the Turkish quidditch community in the best way possible; and enhance the popularity of quidditch in Turkey. BMT will also serve these goals. To achieve these goals, we need your support and help!
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help for these financial issues;

Plane tickets

Visa fees

Others (food, transportation etc.)

story:
FIGHT CHURCH SUMMER CAMP
July 2013 John Neal Memorial Park

as we continue to build and promote our community model in 2014, we wish to add a camping retreat to our list of annual events.
It will be a two-day retreat where we will be sharing a "group camp space" for 100 people on the North Santiam River, west of Detroit Lake, in lovely Lyons Oregon.
this event will be open to all ages, but will be exclusive to extended members of the Fight Church family (pretty much everybody).
We are still flushing out all the details and this will be a complete group project,
but the important thing is that we raise the deposit money ASAP so that we can begin to build from a confirmed date.

My favorite thing about our annual events is that you are guaranteed to spend your time with most active and engaged people in our community; people who consider making the world a better place to be a personal goal. I love these kinds of people and I can't imagine anything as great as camping with 100 of them.

I figure that we can work out all the details as soon as we reserve the date.
Anyone who spends more money than it will take to reserve their personal attendance has the choice to either keep the appropriate number of "tickets" or have us redistribute them. Basically just help us raise the money and then we will make sure everybody is happy.

this will be tent camping.
there are restroom facilities.
there will be one central group bonfire area.
alcohol is permitted, but not in kegs.
children are welcome,
all campers are expected to maintain community norms for behavior.

story: Doyle Tucker has been diagnosed with a fast-growing malignant brain tumor. His children are working on collecting funds to cover expenses associated with his care, including travel to & from Vancouver, BC where he resides.

story:
Healthy, Non-Toxic, Natural Homes...One Step at a Time!

I am currently inspired and excited by my acceptance and upcoming participation in this 6 Week Natural Building Apprenticeship by EcoNest, an organization that focuses on constructing and teaching a building method that is green, environmentally-friendly, healthy, and non-toxic. The building method is focused on using earth, straw, timber frames, and the principles of Bau-Biologie (building biology). I am very honored to have been accepted to be an apprentice this year under Robert LaPorte, the founder of the EcoNest Building Company. Only 4 apprentices are accepted each year so this is a very unique opportunity for me to have.

This apprenticeship experience will take my building and craftsmanship to the next level so that I can continue to educate people on how to build healthy homes for longer, healthier, happier lives. I was introduced to many natural building techniques while studying and building in Oregon this past summer. I discovered the EcoNest apprentice program while I was there and I knew that it was the next step that I needed to take in my journey of becoming a well respected craftsman of natural, healthy homes.

Over the past 2 years, I have educated thousands of people on the practices and principles of Natural Building, with a focus on cob/earthen buildings. I created a website to further this educational cause and to help make this knowledge mainstream. My website is: www.thiscobhouse.com. I have also held several presentations and workshops to educate on Natural Building.

Now I need your help! I want to keep teaching people how they can construct healthier homes for themselves. It is a continual learning process. Help me get the learning that I need so that I can pass it on to my ever-growing network of builders and home-owners. This apprenticeship training at EcoNest is indispensable in my quest for building healthy homes. 

Apart from the hands-on building experience, the program will teach about the dangers of conventional building materials from indoor air pollution, toxic building materials and limited testing of building products. It will cover: why standard building processes are not healthful, what to do differently, and how to obtain alternative materials. More and more people are suffering a wide range of health problems today due to the toxic buildings that they live and work in.

Help to make a healthy change throughout the world in the way we build our homes!

What I Need & What You Get

I need to raise $4,000 toward my participation in the Apprenticeship. All money will go towards tuition fees, tools, lodging, and transportation costs. The tuition for the program is $3,000. I also have to purchase several tools, and then pay my way from Tennessee to Oregon and get a place to stay. Would you be willing to help support my journey into this empowering movement by making a contribution? Any amount, from modest to eye-popping, is welcome and very appreciated!

And in appreciation of your support, I am giving away some great rewards!

Donate $25 or more

For donations of $25 or more, you will receive an online photo album recording and documenting my whole 6-week apprenticeship program. You also get my downloadable book: 

  • Build a Cob House: A Step-By-Step Guide

Donate $50 or more

For donations of $50 or more, you will receive an online photo album recording and documenting my whole 6-week apprenticeship program. You also get two of my downloadable books: 

  • Build a Cob House: A Step-By-Step Guide
  • Cob to Code: The Owner-Builder's Guide to Cob Homes and Building Codes

Donate $100 or more

For donations of $100 or more, you will receive:

My online photo album recording and documenting my whole 6-week apprenticeship program. 

My video journal recording and documenting my whole 6-week apprenticeship program. Videos will be viewable online and you can download them.

You ALSO get 4 of my downloadable rewards:

  • Build a Cob House: A Step-By-Step Guide
  • Cob to Code: The Owner-Builder's Guide to Cob Homes and Building Codes
  • Cob Garden Wall Building Plans
  • "The Freeman" - Tiny Cob House Plans

Donate $500 or more (Ultimate Bundle Package)

You get all of the above rewards! PLUS you receive: 

  • 1 hour consultation with me to get you started on building your own healthy, natural home
  • I will design a personalized home for you using Natural Building methods with clay, straw, timber, and non-toxic materials. I will deliver your project in 3D SketchUp perspectives and concept designs.

The Impact

Millions of people today are chronically ill from toxic indoor environmental exposures.

"In this era of unprecedented technological advancement, it stands to reason that we would use our knowledge to create indoor environments with exceptional vitality that would enhance our health and our sense of well-being. But this has not been the case.
Indoor air pollution is one of the top 4 environmental health risks identified by the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the Scientific Advisory Board authorized by Congress to consult with the EPA on technical matters. Indoor pollution is estimated to cause thousands of cancer deaths and hundreds of thousands of respiratory health problems each year. Millions of children have experienced elevated blood levels of contaminants resulting from their exposure to indoor pollutants."
Excerpt from "Prescriptions for A Healthy House" by Paula Baker-Laporte, Erica Elliot, and John Banta

With your contribution, you are helping to spread a healthy and sustainable type of building, avoiding the pitfalls of modern homes that cause acute chemical sensitivities for people, and instead allowing people to live simply, in harmony with nature.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this and spread the word. I really hope to make a positive change in healthy, environmentally-friendly building, and I really need your support to make this a reality.

Tell your friends, share on facebook, and spread the word about healthy building!

I thank you for your support, and I'm very excited to share this journey with you and the world!

Many thanks,

Alex

story:
Who is the Hero?

Justin Wren


Justin "The Viking" Wren is a former professional Mixed Martial Artist, who has since given up his dream of being an athlete, and traded it for being something much more. I am a member of a MMA Forum called "The Underground" where often times fighters themselves will post and interact with the fans directly. I immediately took notice to his posts about Justin doing amazing things in the Congo to save the Pygmy population. I was inspired and tuned in to his posts. Then when he posted this picture of his water filtration system, I knew that I could offer help:



Justin has contracted malaria, typhoid, and black water fever while working in the Congo, and is in dire need of clean water. He is currently helping the village dig wells so that they may sustain their own water supply, but in the meantime he needs a much better system. 

When I travelled to Haiti in 2012, one of our sole purposes was to filter water for villagers, and we did so extremely efficiently with a product from Aqua Sun called the Responder S, a portable Unit that is Solar or 12 volt Powered. This unit weighs only 50 lbs and can, with the power of the sun, filter over 100 GALLONS of water per day.



What We Need:

The Aqua Sun Responder S, along with the appropriate filters that will allow it to be used daily for an ENTIRE YEAR is just over $2k. I am asking for $2500 to purchase the unit and cover shipping costs while any additional money that is raised passed the amount will go directly to the effort, such as requested Mosquito nets to help protect the villagers from the deadly diseases that mosquitos carry. This state of the art technology is above the rest because of it's portability, ease of use, efficiency, and that the power of the sun is all it needs to filter 100 gallons of water per day.



The Impact

It's easy to understand the need for clean water anywhere a human population is residing. Justin is heading up the digging of wells to get the Pygmy villagers fresh water, but in the meantime has been contracting various diseases such as Typhoid and Blackwater fever. This filter can not only help save his crew and locals from drinking dangerous water in the time that they wait for the wells to be dug, but also as a sustainable resource as it pumps 100 gallons of water per day on Solar Power, and the filters will last an entire year of continuous use before needing replaced at a reasonable cost. The group that I volunteered with in Haiti had one of these amazing units, and it was intentionally to be used for our water source as we helped the locals. Once our leaders saw it's impact on the communities, they decided to leave it with the locals and it has been a blessing for schools and orphanages around Port au Prince. I have no doubt that this machine will have an even larger impact for Justin's mission in the Congo.

Who am I?

Robert Kugler


I am a former Marine Staff Sergeant, turned Actor/Humanitarian. I came to the Los Angeles area nearly 4 years ago to pursue acting and have had some small successes, but in the last year have focused nearly 100% on Humanitarianism and Non-Profits, taking trips to Haiti a year after the earthquake to help teach first aid and filter water, Oklahoma for the tornado relief, as well as Illinois and Colorado for flood relief. I am involved in many NonProfit groups for Veterans, and strive to connect people from each Organization, so that we may have an unlimited collective network of resources. Once I read of Justin's work and saw his lack of good water filtration, I knew this was how I could help. 

Thank you so much for reading, and any contributions and sharing of this page are greatly appreciated.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, you can still help by sharing the post and spreading the word, asking others to share as well! He also has an Indiegogo page for his Non Profit Fight for the Forgotten, HERE.



See the local Children in amazement of "The Great White Sasquatch:"

story:
1 Day, 6 Teams

...competing for a prize of 80,000 shillings...

and the chance to bring their big idea to life!

Join us in empowering the youth of Kibera as ambassadors of health and champions of hope! This fall, Hope for Kibera will host the 1st Annual Empowerment for Health Conference, challenging students to design and present their own unique ideas to affect positive change in Kibera, Africa’s largest “informal settlement.” Through broad, creative discussion and mentorship to strengthen project concepts, Hope for Kibera (H4K) will engage and empower youth to address the issues that impact their health and their lives. Your support will provide seed funding for the big idea that emerges from this exchange of ideas, and the capacity to empower Kibera's next generation of leaders.

Why This is Important

When we started Hope for Kibera in the summer of 2007, it was because of statistics like these:

  • “Approximately 2.5 million slum dwellers [live in Nairobi’s informal settlements], representing 60% of the capital’s population, but occupying only 6% of the land.”

  • Kibera has no sewage infrastructure. 1 pit latrine may be shared by 50 households, and most are emptied into the river, causing typhoid and cholera.

  • Unwanted pregnancies are rampant, exacerbated by rape and forced prostitution. Affecting up to 50% of young women (ages 16 to 25) at any given time, these pregnancies too often result in abortion, ostracization, or a lifetime of poverty for mother and child.

  • Unemployment affecting over 50% of residents, despite the fact that most families moved to Kibera in search of jobs.

  • A resulting life expectancy of 30 years for Kibera residents, compared to 50 years in the rest of Kenya, and nearly 80 years in the U.S.

(Sources: http://kiberalawcentre.org/facts/ ; http://www.kibera.org.uk/Facts.html)

What we realized – from the amazing generosity we were shown; from the pervasive optimism, and frequent laughter, despite facing harsh realities; from the friendships we cherish to this day – was the amazing potential that exists here in Kibera, in its entrepreneurs and community health workers, in its creative, artistic children and parents with such stories of life, who all hold real solutions. We learned that what this vibrant community needs most is access to opportunity.

Here's How You Can Help:

  • $900 will fully fund the 1st Place team’s start-up project for one year.

  • $500 will partially fund the 2nd and 3rd place projects, will provide meaningful, capacity-building support to team members like training in community mobilization, social entrepreneurship or project management, or will help to cover their school fees so they can continue their education.*

  • $200 will cover the cost of the venue and supplies, including healthy refreshments for participants at the 1st Annual Empowerment for Health Conference.

We have already raised $250, which will support the local entrepreneurs who will provide your perks and go back to Indiegogo for fees, supporting other awesome crowdfunding projects. Any funds raised above and beyond our goal would enable us to fund two top projects, or to scale up the winning project.

*The winning teams will be selected by an independent panel of judges, including community leaders and experts in health and sustainable development. Runners-up prizes will be determined based on a survey of participants and the size of the selected teams.

What You'll Get in Return

Along with our sincere thanks for helping out an important cause, we've chosen -- and created -- a handful of "perks" to express our gratitude: 

jewelry and artwork by Kenyan artists


a first-edition bumper sticker

or

and a limited-edition t-shirt to show off your support for Kibera!

(note: t-shirt will read "Health is Hope." This image is include to show the layout and print style.)

Risks, Challenges & Impact

Hope for Kibera (H4K) was created in 2007 and established as a Community-Based Organization in Nairobi in 2011. Our six active mentors are all local youth leaders from Kibera/Nairobi with experience in community health, education, outreach/communications, research, project management, and community mobilization. Our three US-based advisors provide expertise in organizational management, health, social entrepreneurship and information technology, along with connection to resources less available in Kibera.

Over the past seven years, Hope for Kibera has worked with schools and students in Kibera in numerous capacities, including through several large events. The upcoming Conference, which we have been planning since early this year, will be the largest event we have undertaken to date. To prepare, we have been thinking through all logistics including setting the agenda, emcees, sound systems, seating, guest speakers and judges, refreshments as well as outreach/marketing and the message of empowerment for systemic change that we aim to deliver.

A significant but exciting challenge will be selecting one winning team out of the innovative proposals that are advancing to the Conference. The ideas range from a multi-level environmental and food security program, through which poultry farming and gardening will combat malnutrition among Kibera's children, to an artists’ workspace empowering students economically—and enabling them to remain in school—to a range of environmental initiatives applying creative approaches like recycling, water piping systems and community mobilization to alleviate the horrible problems of waste and communicable disease in Kibera. Although difficult to choose between, we know that these teams will bring forth an inspiring debate about the many possible ways to create positive change in Kibera.

In order to ensure equal footing in the contest and transparency in the selection process, we circulated comprehensive guidelines (the “fine print”) reviewed by the teams prior to entering the contest, and we are enlisting a panel of independent judges to help determine the 1st, 2nd and 3rd place winners. This will ameliorate any risk of perceived favoritism, as H4K has worked more closely with some teams than with others, while also helping to spur conversation about health and social justice in Kibera.

The students have been preparing as well, spending the past three months brainstorming, researching and refining their project ideas with feedback from H4K mentors. During the presentation phase, the contestants will field questions about their team’s capacity, their implementation plan, and their project’s potential sustainability, among others. Over the next year, H4K will continue working with the winning team, connecting them with additional resources and expertise to ensure that they are set up for success.

In all, we will continue to concentrate our efforts so that the 1st Annual Empowerment for Health Conference not only concludes a successful day filled with community-building, information-sharing and the cross-fertilization of ideas, but that it launches a project that, led by the youth with support from a growing network of advocates and collaborators, will effect sustainable change for better health in Kibera.

In truth, the challenges we face are deeply entrenched—symptomatic of a history of colonization and global inequity—and will require systemic change far greater than what any of us can do alone, or in the scope of one year. Rather than turning away at this incredible obstacle, we aim to ignite a movement of hope. It is our own hope that whether their team is funded or not, all participants will come away from this summit with the belief that their voices matter, that health should not be a privilege of the rich, that strength comes in many forms and we all have something to contribute.

Thus, with your help, we will create a ripple of empowerment in the hearts of the youth and plant a seed of belief that we all can and we all must engage in these tough conversations and difficult work—so that in time the ripple will become a crashing wave, and the seed a towering tree, to topple those barriers and nourish a more equitable world.

Other Ways You Can Support Kibera

Donations of any size are welcome – even $10 goes a long way in Kibera, where the average teacher’s or nurse’s annual salary is only $1,300.

We know that gifts come in many forms. If you have passion, knowledge, or skills you wish to contribute to H4K’s mission of empowerment for better health, please contact us at info@hopeforkibera.org. Volunteers are welcome in Nairobi or to spread our message and build connections with like-minded organizations around the world.

Finally, the simplest thing you can do to help us deepen our impact is to share this campaign across your own networks!

Asante sana! Many thanks!
story_txt:
1 Day, 6 Teams ...competing for a prize of 80,000 shillings...
and the chance to
bring their big idea to life!


Join us in empowering
the youth of Kibera as ambassadors of health and champions of hope! This fall, Hope for Kibera will host the 1st Annual Empowerment for Health Conference, challenging students
to design and present their own unique ideas to affect positive
change in Kibera, Africa’s largest “informal settlement.” Through broad, creative discussion and mentorship
to strengthen project concepts, Hope for Kibera (H4K) will engage and
empower youth to address the issues that impact their health and
their lives. Your support will provide seed funding for the big idea that
emerges from this exchange of ideas, and the capacity to empower Kibera's next
generation of leaders.




Why This is Important When we started Hope for Kibera in the summer of 2007, it was because of statistics like these: 

“Approximately 2.5 million slum dwellers [live in Nairobi’s informal settlements],
representing 60% of the capital’s population, but occupying only 6% of the land.”
Kibera has no
sewage infrastructure. 1 pit latrine may be shared by 50 households, and most
are emptied into the river, causing typhoid and cholera.
Unwanted
pregnancies are rampant, exacerbated by rape and forced prostitution. Affecting
up to 50% of young women (ages 16 to 25) at any given time, these pregnancies
too often result in abortion, ostracization, or a lifetime of poverty for
mother and child.
Unemployment
affecting over 50% of residents, despite the
fact that most families moved to Kibera in search of jobs.
A resulting life
expectancy of 30 years for Kibera residents, compared to 50 years in the
rest of Kenya, and nearly 80 years in the U.S. 
(Sources:
http://kiberalawcentre.org/facts/ ; http://www.kibera.org.uk/Facts.html)
What we realized – from the amazing generosity we were shown; from the
pervasive optimism, and frequent laughter, despite facing harsh realities; from
the friendships we cherish to this day – was the amazing potential that exists
here in Kibera, in its entrepreneurs and community health workers, in its
creative, artistic children and parents with such stories of life, who all hold
real solutions. We learned that what this vibrant community needs most is
access to opportunity.
Here's How You Can Help:

$900 will fully fund the 1st Place
team’s start-up project for one year.
$500 will partially fund the 2nd and
3rd place projects, will provide meaningful, capacity-building
support to team members like training in community mobilization, social
entrepreneurship or project management, or will help to cover their school fees
so they can continue their education.*
$200 will cover the cost of the venue and
supplies, including healthy refreshments for participants at the 1st
Annual Empowerment for Health Conference.

We have already raised $250, which will support the local entrepreneurs
who will provide your perks and go back to Indiegogo for fees, supporting other
awesome crowdfunding projects. Any funds raised
above and beyond our goal would enable us to fund two top projects, or to scale
up the winning project.
*The winning teams will be selected by an independent panel of judges,
including community leaders and experts in health and sustainable development.
Runners-up prizes will be determined based on a survey of participants and the
size of the selected teams.

What You'll Get in Return
Along with our sincere thanks for helping out an important cause, we've chosen -- and created -- a handful of "perks" to express our gratitude: 
jewelry and artwork by Kenyan artists


a first-edition bumper sticker

or


and a limited-edition t-shirt to show off your support for Kibera!

(note: t-shirt will read "Health is Hope." This image is include to show the layout and print style.)

story:
Our friend Mike Adam was recently diagnosed with Non-Hodgkins Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma (ALCL). This is a Rare and Aggressive rapid spreading form of Cancer. He is in excrucitaing pain and Doctors advised him to stop working.

They will be admitting him to the Oncology Unit at Sarasota Memorial Hospital on Tuesday to begin his Chemotherapy. He will be receiving treatments starting the first step in his long fight to hopeful recovery. There are currently a few plans in the works for local fundraising events but every little bit will help.
 
Please keep Mike in your thoughts and well wishes. Let's show him how much we care!

story:
Introduction
My name is Bill Iannuccilli and I am the founder of new company, Molecular Troubleshooting. Our innovative goal is to provide a multi-gene genetic testing service in a market place where testing for 1 or 2 genes is standard. I am a molecular biologist and genomic scientist with more than 20 years experience in both industry and academia. My background includes experience in DNA and genotyping instrumentation design, applications and next generation technology development, cell biology, microbiology,  electro-mechanical engineering and robotics. My dream is to provide physicians with the most genetic information possible so they can make more informed decisions to save countless lives. You can help make that happen!

Our Campaign
My campaign is to raise capital to start a multi-gene genetic testing company which will provide multi-gene tests to provide more information about the disease state which in turn can lead to better treatment and a better outcome or prognosis for the patient.
We will provide multi-gene testing for autism, cancer, cardiomyopathies (heart disease), inherited diseases, and exome analysis. Approximately 100 genes will be tested in each of the above tests and more than 20,000 mutations will be interrogated in the exome analysis. The company will also test for drug resistance in microorganisms to better combat these infectious agents. Environmental tests will also be offered to help identify microorganisms in different environments and in particular water to identify pathogenic organisms and to profile the population.

                                           

About Us
I have worked on applications development for one of the first automated DNA sequencing systems the Pharmacia ALF, and on the final design team for the MegaBACE at Molecular Dynamics. There we developed hardware, software and applications for the first high throughput DNA sequencing/genotyping system for the Human Genome Project.
When I worked at the Columbia University Genome Center I held the post of Central Coordinator of DNA Sequencing and Chemical Biology.  I worked on the genomic sequencing of the causative agent of Legionaires disease Legionella pnuemophila, antibiotic resistance in bacteria, human genetic screening including BRCAI, and investigated the genes involved in cholesterol metabolism. Collaborating with the Nobel Laureate Eric Kandel, we worked on elucidating the genes involved in short term memory. I have published in the scientific journals Cell, Protein Chemistry, and Science and I can bring a wealth of experience and knowledge to the company.

Why We're Valuable
Having been in science for more than 20 years I have seen a lot of important research information not being utilized in genetic testing. I have been personally affected from family and friends that were afflicted with cancer and heart disease and only limited genetic testing was available addressing only 1 or 2 genes. There is the ability to test for multiple genes and our tests look at as many genes as possible thought to be involved in the disease state.
By testing for more genes we can more accurately identify the disease state and possible differences within the disease to tailor treatment for the patient, providing better treatment and a better outcome and quality of life.
In the near future we will also provide whole genome sequencing, the sequencing of all of the genes in your body, and will be able to store your genome and re-test at later dates  when more information about genetic information become available. Molecular medicine is coming of age and the more information we can utilize the better we can address disease states and improve your quality of life. We will be at the forefront of molecular medicine with your help.
Please visit our website at moleculartroubleshooting.com for more information.

What we need
Molecular Troubleshooting requires to setup the testing laboratory such as renting the laboratory space, purchasing the DNA sequencing system, other laboratory equipment and reagents. the rental space has been identified and the rent is  $1.300 per month. The equipment is the major cost. The DNA sequencing system that will be used is the Illumina MiSeq system which is the preferred system for clinical applications and was selected by the FDA for the identification of food borne pathogens. The MiSeq system will be leased to minimize cost.
We need $250,000 to setup the laboratory and purchase the laboratory equipment, place a down payment for the MiSeq system, rental space deposit and rent, reagents,  salaries, and the first year's operating costs. The company should be producing enough revenue to be self sufficient after the first year.

What you get
Our perks will be structured so that all contributors from $5 and up will have their name appear on the Founders page on our company website. Contributors rewards are tiered as follows:$50 dollars and above will receive a custom designed Molecular Troubleshooting pen with the company logo, contributions of $100 and up will receive a sporty Molecular Troubleshooting T-shirt bearing the company logo, contributions of $500 and above will receive a 25% discount on one of our available genetic tests and contributions of $1,000 and above will receive a 50% discount on one of our available genetic tests. You will also receive two reports from your genetic test, a technical report for your physician and a report in layman's terms for you. Everyone receives the satisfaction of helping to set up a new genetic testing company with a powerful new multi-gene testing approach to provide more information for better patient treatment and care and quality of life.

Successful track record
In the past I have worked on many projects and brought them to fruition. I worked on building the next generation capillary electrophoresis high throughput sequencing instrument the MegaBACE, used in the bulk of the sequencing for the Human Genome Project. During this project I was on the final design team, helped develop applications, performed the beta testing and helped place and install the first 100 units. I have also worked on many other projects before and after that such as: the ALF slab gel DNA sequencing system for Pharmacia one of the first automated DNA sequencers, the Qiagen BioRobot one of the first robotic systems for high throughput DNA sample preparation, the EST sequencing of Aplysia to help elucidate the basis for short term memory, investigated antibiotic resistance in bacteria, and the full genomic sequence of the causative agent for Legionaires disease to name a few. Hard work, persistence and creative problem solving have helped me complete the projects that I have undertaken.
I know how to bring a project to completion and look forward to that with Molecular Troubleshooting to provide multi-gene genetic testing to bear on some of the worst afflictions of our time. 

How you can help
We would greatly appreciate if you would contribute to our campaign and no amount is too small. If you can not contribute you can help in other ways by spreading the word about Molecular Troubleshooting and our Indiegogo crowd funding campaign and contact others who may be able to contribute. Any efforts that you can provide are greatly appreciated.

story:
Hello my name is Michael Yancy Jr. and I founded Super Sport Athletic, Inc. in
2012.  I’m originally from San Diego, CA, was a 4th round draft pick by the New York Mets in 1997. For the last 7 years I’ve work with therapeutic foster kids in Phoenix, Arizona.

I would like to raise money to help my non-profit organization receive tax exempt
status and also be able to take at risk teens and therapeutic foster care kids on
fishing trips and start baseball leagues to help them put their energy into
something positive and fun. I believe these at-risk teens can become successful
adults if given the chance to enjoy a new hobby and have someone to motivate
them to be positive and successful.

Did you know that 70% of all kids in foster kids end up in jail or homeless? By contributing to Super Sport Athletic, Inc. you are helping foster care children learn that there are people who care about their well being and that these children will have the opportunities and support that all children should have. You’re helping them become all they can be, a productive and positive human being.


In order to help foster care and at-risk teens nationwide, Super Sport Athletic, Inc.
needs to become a tax exempt non-profit organization. We currently need $1,500
to file 501(c) 3 application and also to buy life vests, fishing poles, a baseball
pitching machine, gloves, bats and cleats.


Fishing is a very therapeutic sport, I believe it kept me out of trouble. Through my experience with Baseball and fishing I believe it is a way of having kids focus their energy and frustrations into something positive and rewarding.  Sometimes all it takes is a change of environment to motivate a young person.


In today’s world bullying is out of control and the prison population has grown
tremendously.  Some of these at-risk kids are the bullies themselves because they too have been bullied by a negative adult or peer.  Super Sport Athletic,Inc. wants to give these kids a new perspective on life and show them that they can break the cycle.  Mentoring our youth goes a long way, we all need a strong support system and a push to become our best. 

 

I’ve worked with kids who were in and out of juvenile detention centers, kids that
didn’t believe life could be better for them. Through my fishing program I’ve watched these same kids go off to college. 

 

If you cannot contribute to Super Sport Athletic, Inc. please help me spread the
word.  Thank you for taking time to helpme help others.

story:
The Gilberts Pirates 9U Baseball Team would like to sincerely ask you for your support in helping our players and families in lessening the financial burden that accrues during a Travel Baseball season.  Our players and families are special!   We didn't hold tryouts or enter into an existing program.  We are a non-for-profit organization that started from ground zero so we could keep a great bunch of teammates and families together for years to come with the goal of continued success. 

We offer the opportunity for our players to become part of a family by giving them the best opportunity for success as baseball players but more importantly, in life.  Fundamental characteristics such as confidence, self-esteem, sportsmanship, self discipline, and teamwork are key components in becoming part of the Pirate Way.

Your help and support will help offset some of our tournament travel expenses and give these hard working young men a well deserved experience.  

Even if you are unable to help financially, we would appreciate your spreading the word about our campaign.  Every share helps, especially through Facebook, Twitter, and e-mail.

Thank You & Always Keep Swinging,

Coach Joe Maskivish

are special!   We didn't hold tryouts
or enter into an existing program.  We are
a non-for-profit organization that started from ground zero so we could keep a
great bunch of teammates and families together for years to come with the goal
of continued success. 
We offer the opportunity for our players to become part of a
family by giving them the best opportunity for success as baseball players but
more importantly, in life.  Fundamental
characteristics such as confidence, self-esteem, sportsmanship, self
discipline, and teamwork are key components in becoming part of the Pirate Way.
Your help and support will help offset some of our tournament
travel expenses and give these hard working young men a well deserved experience.  
Even if you are unable to help financially, we would
appreciate your spreading the word about our campaign.  Every share helps, especially through
Facebook, Twitter, and e-mail.
Thank You & Always Keep Swinging,
Coach Joe Maskivish

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Steve Griffin, I have been Director of Athletics at Maryvale Schools since 2000. We need to raise $50,000.00 to keep our Modified sports programs for the 2014-15 season. We have over 200 student/athletes involved in our Modified sports program. Our sports programs are very important to our student/athletes because our main focus is to help our student/athletes become well rounded young men and woman. Our student/athletes know that education comes first and to participate in sports they must be respectful, hard working, and dedicated. Many of our young student/athletes would be lost with out Modified sports, for some of them it is the only reason they behave and do well in school. We need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Over the past 10 years our Athletic budget has been cut in half. This year we have nothing left to cut put programs. The cost to run our 12 Modified programs is $49,500.00, which covers buses to away games, officials fees for home games, and coaches pay for 13 coaches.

We will be offering perks for your donations such as; season passes for home football and basketball games, Maryvale hoodies, and recognition plaques that will be placed in our fitness rooms. We need you all to show your Maryvale Pride and make this happen, "once a Flyer, always a Flyer"!!!


The Impact

Your contributions will mean a second chance for all our Modified Flyers. It will give our kids a chance to belong to an athletic family that strives to be the best they can both in sports and in society. Please help make our program happen, we need your help. Over 200 student/athletes are counting on you...Maroon and White!!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know times are tough and it may be hard for you to donate, but even a dollar can help. There are thousands and thousands of Maryvale graduates, if every graduate just donated  one dollar we would be able to keep our program going for years.

Please help pass the word about this fund raiser, put it on Facebook, twitter, use the Indiegogo share tools. Anything you can do to help us would be greatly appresiated. Thank you in advance for your help.

story:
Strengthening Family Ties

Notes From When™ software will use patented technology to help people write email notes that help kids understand how the world has changed since their parents (or their grandparents) were their age. For instance, the software will automatically draft a note from a parent to a child containing examples of what the world was like back when the child's grandparents were the child's age. The examples will be automatically selected by the software from topics the child is interested in.

Examples

You can see example notes in the Gallery and in the videos, showing what the software could automatically create by using the historic facts it provides, with the information about relationships, family events, and interests the user will provide.

Update: Prototype Underway

Exciting news - our web-based prototype design is near completion, and we are vetting programmers to implement it. We hope to have it up and running soon. The prototype will generate notes with three topics: Science, Music, and Sports. Stay tuned for updates - we look forward to your feedback on the prototype!

Project Progress and Plan

User experience specifications, examples of notes the software will generate, and underlying technology for the software are described in US Patent 8224817 and pending patent applications, and also in a detailed storyboard. Funding for this project will support implementation of the design in software by programmers under the direction of the project lead. Implementation will begin with the Apple iPad® platform, and progress from there to Apple iPhone® and Android® phone platforms as funding permits. Any additional funding will be used to spread the word about the software.

Software sometimes takes longer than expected to implement. But the Notes From When™ design is well documented, the underlying technology is well understood, and capable programmers are available to be hired and work under John's direction. So the main challenge is raising the funds to get the software implemented.

Project People

Notes From When™ project lead and software architect is John Ogilvie. John has degrees in math, computer science, and law. He worked as a computer programmer on graphics projects and on other software projects, and wrote two books for programmers. John is an inventor with over 20 issued US patents (primarily on software technology), as well as a patent attorney, son, father, and husband. He’s been working on the idea and design for this software since 2007, as the inventor of the technology design in US Patent No. 8224817 and as architect of the software design described in the app storyboard; excerpts from the storyboard are shown in the detailed video at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JOIbflXkRcs .
